Dr. Walker is a hilarious guy. Although he can sometimes go off track for a few minutes in lecture, he still explains the material fully by the end of the session. The problems he does in lecture are way harder than those on the midterms, so theyre pretty good practice.

Does not care about his students or their success. Sounds like he'd rather be anywhere else in the world when giving lectures. Very little guidance on homework that that comes from online textbook - the guy does not make any questions or grade anything himself. Easy pass if you already know physics, but won't learn anything new.

Terry is hilarious, but the lectures are all over the place and hard to follow. I had physics background from HS so I stopped going to lectures because I didn't find them helpful, just got all I needed from recitations and the textbook. Definitely wouldn't recommend if you struggle with physics, but not too bad otherwise.

He is a funny professor and focuses on making jokes in class rather than getting material finished. His explanations during lectures are very hard to keep up with. He gives weekly quizzes which are really hard. He also doesnt answer emails. Dont take this class unless you have to.

Only take if you have to! Set up a GroupMe to study w/ classmatesvery helpful. Prof can be rude or condescending. Jokes come off derogatory. Class is stressful, quizzes are challenging, homework is time-consuming. Final is 50% of grade. Some work (HW & any online work/quiz) is open note, some (in-person quizzes) are not. A curve *MIGHT be applied.

Words can't seem to describe how much I disliked this professor. I was so withdrawn during lectures and none of the information managed to get to me by the way he presented it. You'll see reviews saying he's funny, but I must inform you that his jokes get stale really quick. If you're SLDS, prepare for a painful time trying to figure accommodations

Terry isn't the best professor in terms of lecturing, but he's a super funny guy and makes the class enjoyable. Came in with very little physics background and did well without too much effort. Final is all multiple choice/old questions. Exams aren't too bad either with 75-83# avgs. Often off topic in lecture

Dr. Walker is definitely the funniest professor I have had. I got over 100% in his class, but I remembered a lot from AP Physics. His biggest flaw is he assumes his tests won't be difficult because he knows the info. Just don't get too caught up in him oversimplifying things and assuming the test will be a joke. Study and you will do fine

Walker is funny and when he's cracking jokes, it keeps you engaged in lecture. However, his methods of explaining topics is usually confusing and he can't rephrase it to make sense. He has weird ways of solving problems and it's usually easier to learn how to do the problems from the textbook. We did get >15% curves on the midterms at least.

He's sort of entertaining and kind of funny, but really distracting in class. I found it difficult to focus on physics as he wasn't even focused himself. Often lecture digressed from a point he was making to ranting about Trump, feminism, or cracking jokes. Doesn't know how to explain things in laymen's terms either, when asked to clarify.
this dude is HILARIOUS.  literally he should be a stand up comic.  easy class.

He's a hilarious guy and I'd love to talk politics with him, but I learned more about his hatred for Donald Trump than I did anything about physics. He cares more about hearing himself talk than help. One student asked for clarification and he wouldn't repeat himself. Do not take unless you have a physics background
Professor Walker is a good teacher.  If you took AP in high school this class will be a joke.  His quizzes are old homework problems; exams are old quiz questions.

His lectures are really confusing because he teaches everything symbolically instead of working through the entire problem and putting in the numbers. His lectures left me frustrated and with half worked through notes that didn't make sense. 1st midterm was just like the homework. 2nd was insanely hard nothing to do with homework!

Chelsea is very empathetic and kind. Her lectures are easy to follow with the activity sheets, and the lab at the end of each class is like a COSI exhibit. The exams are straightforward, and I enjoyed attending class.

Chelsea is a sweetheart and this class is so easy. She even told us at the beginning of the semester it is not a high-stakes course. The material is not super math heavy, as she does her best to emphasize the concepts. If you show your work but get the wrong answer, you still get credit. She is gracious with late work and her lectures are concise.

absolutely love her! such an easy A just make sure you make good notes. We have homework every dew weeks super short and she grades very easy. All of the tests are OPEN NOTE and after you get your test back you are able to do corrections. She very good about accepting late work, she will accept it till the course is over.
Good man, but bad course. If you want to see you get 28/30 which is lower than mean 28.1/30, you could choose him:)
Evil. If you can choose regular Quantum Mechanics, choose the regular one to avoid Dr. Mathur!
Bad old man!
He could probably teach a 5 year old quantum mechanics.
Never could tell if he was trying to be funny but much of what comes out of his mouth is hysterical. Brilliant guy and great lecturer.
This man loves chalk and has beautiful hands. He is without flaws.

He is honestly one of the best professors I have ever had. He explains even the most difficult concepts with ease. He keeps the class interested and is such a great person to be around. On another note, he really likes chalk.

Samir Mathur truly loves his subject and really cares about his students. One time, I spoke with him about why he liked to teach freshman and he said, "because they are always so eager to learn. You can tell the difference between the ones who are there for a grade and the ones who truly want to understand." He explains rather than tells. Great guy

Dr. Mathur is a genius. He can convey Calc 3 concepts to someone who just started Calc 1, and they will understand it. He does not assign much work (spent 40 min/week on homework), but you'll learn a lot anyway. Finally, he is always in a pleasant mood, and his passion for learning will slowly leak into your psyche as the semester progresses.

I switched to the honors class after being in the regular section for a week. SO glad I did this. He is truly passionate about the subject, and hearing him talk about astrophysics and relativity experiments was really engaging. I'm not even a physics or math major, and I truly enjoyed this class. Easily my favorite professor at OSU.
Mathur is the best.  If you want something really complicated made simple, here's the man to do it.  He'll put stuff in your head while you daydream in his class.  The best.
Samir has an enviable grasp of concepts and manages to convey them very well.
B/c he is a genius.
Seriously, why does he lick it off of his fingers?
Yes, he does love the chalk.
This man has an insatiable appetite for chalk!!
Angel professor~
Dr. Landsman is really an angel! Choose her and choose honor intermediate E&M course, and you will never regret! (Even this is simpler than regular intermediate E&M course)
Landsman is a very good woman. Her lectures are very amazing. The homework is a little difficult but useful. The difficulty of test is reasonable. Recommend Dr. Landsman!
Tests were of easy to fair difficulty and were given generous curves. Homework was not burdensome and lectures were easy enough to follow.

Proffessor Hughes is one of the best professors I have ever had. Yes this class is very tough but she explained things amazingly, truly cares about her students, and is great at physics. This class is confusing so go to lectures and take notes, study for exams. Her office hours are great and she is great at teaching as well as physics.

She cares a lot about student success and her lectures are actually helpful. Lecture slides aren't great so going to class is important. Never went to office hours but did email her and receive quick responses. The subject is very difficult and she does her best to teach it. Exams slightly harder than her practice problems but still very close.
She was okay, a lot of her lecture slides are useless. She does top hat questions in class that help a bit. There was no final curve for her class, which is quite astounding for physics.

This is one of the hardest classes I have had to take, but I am glad I got Prof. Hughes. You can tell she really cares about the students. She is very accessible outside of class. The only thing is that everyone was under the impression the class would be curved by a lot, but ended up being curved by very little.

Class itself is pretty bad but she is a good lecturer. Covered the material well and went at a decent pace. Her office hours are extremely helpful for everything in the class. All the midterms were curved 15-20% but the final and the final grade were not curved at all. She is great and helped a lot but the class is still pretty bad

Tough class, but she teaches well. Slides are always available if you missed a lecture, but a few top hat questions each lecture are taken for attendance. Does a good amount of in class examples and is passionate about the topic
VERY great lecturer, very nice & understanding outside of lecture / office hours, probably the biggest reason I passed this class. Grades are harsh, but at least it's curved.
Very tough course but he does a good job teaching and curves the hell out of it.

One of my favorite professors, the lectures are great, and the assignments are a bit difficult, but I can do them seriously without any problem. The exam difficulty is relatively high but the proportion is relatively limited. Process evaluation is highly valued!
Mr. Schumacher is a funny guy, I like to take his course!

1260 was definitely a very fast paced and difficult class however, if you put in the time and also go to office hours you can do okay. He was very understanding and helpful at office hours and wanted his students to succeed, just the course material is very hard so its not like he can give everyone A's.

This class made me rethink everything. I'm sorry but I cant with the fact that he was so oblivious to peoples struggles with the class. The recitation problems were difficult so I found myself sitting there and waiting for class to end. My peers were really condescending and the set up of the class is not good. Take 1250, its just better!!!!!!!!!!!

Class is extremely fast paced and overwhelming (for me at least). Douglass pays too much attention to those who are doing well and doesn't look after those who aren't; I took a lot of time to understand the material and yet ended with a B-, after a curve that he said he wouldn't be able to do bc people were doing too good. Like gurl BFFR, i cant :(

Do not take this class if you do not have extensive physics experience/really enjoy physics. Spent hours studying for all of the tests and 25+ hours studying for the final and did not receive grades that reflected the time I spent practicing. Only helpful at office hours if you understand the material well enough to ask questions he wants to answer

Excellent professor. He taught the course very clearly, and the portion of daily points is around 65%! Therefore, if you put in the effort, you could get a B+ or above. Moreover, he will give the curve, which is decided by the overall grade distribution (but not stricter than the OSU standard).

Do not take this class if you have not taken AP physics. Grades are determined based on how everyone else does, and it is hard to compete with kids that know it already. Schumacher is overall a decent person, but he did promise us a curve the entire semester and BARELY gave us one at the end. If you have not taken physics before, expect a C.

Though the class is tough, Dr Schumacher is a great lecturer and makes the class super interesting. I had taken a physics course in high school, so the pacing of the class felt good, but I'd assume if this is your first time taking physics then it would be a bit fast. Labs are interesting and never once took up more than half of the allotted time.

Extremely tough course, but if you do all the homework and exam preparations then you should make it out with at least a B+. He curves the course at the end to give about half the students A's, and two-thirds B's. Labs & recitations are free points for showing up. Study hard for exams since they are the driving force of your grade.
A great prof to have for a quite rigorous class. The material is hard, but Shumacher does care about students and is very accessible for questions. Ask him about his laser.

Dr. Schumacher is a phenomenal teacher. He truly cares and he is willing to help with anything, not to mention he is probably the most intelligent teacher I have ever has. The class is insanely difficult, but it is curved pretty hard and if you put in the work (which is a ton), then you can come out with a B+ (ish).

Schumacher is really an excellent professor for FEH. His lectures are informative and engaging. I highly recommend this class if you are interested in E&M. It's not easy, but if you put in the effort you will learn a lot.

Dr. Schumacher is the best professor I've ever had. I had him for both 1260 and 1261, and his lectures were great. He looks at pre-lecture comments and addresses them in class and takes the time to go over homework questions if they were particularly difficult. His classes were a lot of work but the curves are generous.

One of the best in the department. Very diligent about looking at prelecture comments and trying to tailor each lecture around those while still incorporating new material. Funny, but productive lectures. Places a large focus on going to office hours. Office hours are very helpful. Exams were tough but fair.
His office hours are essential

Dr. Schumacher is one of the best teachers/professors I've ever had. He explains physics concepts in such an understanding way and if people are confused he'll go over it again until he believes the class understands. His office hours are almost better than his lectures and he is more than willing to help out when you need it.

Dr. Schumacher is one of the best teachers/professors I've ever had. He is very interactive with the class.  If he senses that people are confused over something, he will find a new unique way to describe it. He is very accessible outside of class and has tons of office hours. Very witty, smart, and down to earth.
The class is difficult but he explains the concepts really well.  Labs are useless but easy points.  Very blunt.  Gave a generous curve at the end of the class, makes up for the very difficult tests.
Probably my favorite professor.  Made Physics 1260 an easy class.  The tests are hard, but the curve is generous.  His office hours are the most helpful of any professor I've encountered.

I was already very good at physics when I took his physics 1250 lecture. I went to lecture, he gave you all the formulas you needed for homework problems in class, and I don't think I ever had to open the book for physics 1250. BUT since I did have to buy the book it was very helpful because there are even more help which came in handy in 1251.
Great teacher and his lectures are very helpful. Though if you are a bad test taker this teacher will be very tough.

Very good lecturer, he actually teaches you the material. Gives relatively harder quizzes and exams than other professors but he tries to prepare you for them. Good with explaining in and out of class as well; offers a lot of office hours. Also, just a very fun guy in class and is very down to earth.

If you get Professor Schumacher for 132 you're in good hands. He is by far the best lecturer I had for the entire 130 series. His tests and quizzes can be difficult but he really prepares you for them. Even if you don't like physics, you'll at the very least like Schumacher as a teacher.

Dr. Schu ties for the best professor I've ever had. Schu's explains the material SOOOO well. There's no way you'll leave that class not understanding the concepts. He is also so incredibly dedicated to helping his students. He constantly encourages questions. He is  really a model teacher. Deserves an award for sure. Also he's very witty. Nice guy.

AMAZING!!!!!! I've never had this much fun learning anything in college before! Suggestion: go to his lectures! There is a lot to be learned. Fast paced. Hard quizzes, study, but exams are decent. Lively, fair, best professor I've had!
Really awesome teacher. Lectures were full just about every day and not because we all loved physics.
Dr. Schumacher is an awesome professor! He gets concepts across in a very clear and understandable manner. He likes to joke and move around to keep class lively. Overall an awesome guy!

Dr. Schumacher is a great lecturer.  Very clear, entertaining, and an overall nice guy.  His exams aren't too difficult, but harder than my 131 exams were.  But his quizzes are often ridiculously difficult.  Overall, if you study and do the homework you'll be fine.
Very good instructor really learned a lot.
His lectures are really helpful and easy to understand. Plus, he jokes around at times. He seems pretty friendly, and the class wasn't too difficult. The averages are around 70 for the exams.

He is good and knows the material sooo well that his exams are always new and different. expects students to do more.....and i had to do all the exercise at the end of each chapter just to get a c. The grade depends on my skill but be brepared to do more than enough. i felt good at the end any way cuz i very much know what phy 133 is!!

Some quizzes were straight from HW, some came from nowhere. The exams were impossible. HW is easy, but none of it is on exams. He expects you to do a lot of the learning on your own, so he doesn't go in depth on a lot of stuff. Sample quizzes and exams are totally different from the ones he gives. He has sloppy handwriting because of giant chalk.
Great lecturer.  His exams are nearly impossible.  I got a 45% on my first exam and got an A- in the class so he does curve really well.  If you struggle I highly suggest going to office hours.

Very good lecturer. He's crystal clear with new concepts and material and he makes sure the class understands the material clearly before moving on. Tests and quizzes can be a little tricky, but he gives amazing practice quizzes and exams. They are also directly from the homework, not some crazy applications that you've never seen before. recommend

Very good professor. He keeps his lectures interesting and is always making sure that his students understand the material. Also, if he sees that the class is having trouble, he finds different and helpful ways to explain the material. His tests and quizzes are very, very difficult, so get as many points by doing the hw and going to lab.

One of the best professors I've had at the university. He is VERY willing to go out of his way to help you understand the material if you have trouble. Go to his office hours because it helps and he's good at explaining things several different ways to help you understand. He likes to keep demos and lecture interesting so definitely go to his class

This class was absurdly hard. His tests and class was considerably harder than the other classes and he does not curve well. Doesn't convey things well for whats online, but a good lecturer. I would suggest taking someone elses class, and attending his lecture.

I am not good at Physics so the class has been tough, but Schumacher has probably been one of the better if not the best Physics lecturer that I have had. Don't go into his office hours and ask what will be on the next quiz or midterm   bc the answer you get will be broader than Serena Williams' shoulders. Good teacher, tests are fair.

Very,very fair professor.  No curve balls.  All tests were similar to hw and quizes.  Plenty of points in hw and lab so if you bomb the mt and final, you can still walk with a B.  If it was b/w him and anyone else, definitely Schumacher.

He didn't seem like a very likeable person at first but his lectures were extremely interesting. He made demonstrations fit in so well with what he was teaching on. Also, instead of just deriving equations that were already in the book, he went through conceptual problems and helped with the problem solving aspects of them. This was really helpful.

i used to be frustrated by how he talked a lot about not much in between working examples. In the end though, his lectures are organized well and easy to understand, even with harder topics.  his occasional goofy demos and "actor's reenactments" aren't always exactly informative, but they are funny enough to be well worth it.
One of the best teachers I have ever had. Hard but vary vary fair. Great curve too.

Dr Schumacher is a great lecturer but not a very good teacher. His tests and example problems are too difficult for an entry-level physics class. I got "B's" in chem 251 thru 254 and a "B" in math 415, but got a "D+" in this class? Whatever, I'll just retake it at Columbus State...

Dr. Schumacher is a really great teacher! His lectures were always very helpful and informative, yet entertaining at the same time. He's really good at communicating the difficult concepts of physics 131 in a way that is easier to understand. The midterm was a bit challenging, but not impossible. Do the homework problems and study! Good luck!
His lectures are cear and understandable, with a little humor everyonce in a while.

Dr. Schumacher is an outstanding lecturer.  He keep the whole class of 150 ppl entertained which is quite an accomplishment.  He does like to bs around a little bit, but he just wants to make sure you get a clear understanding of the matierial. He is extremely willing to help.  He is a very generous man.  Tests are hard as hell though! Curve helps!
Nice professor, kept lecture interesting and tests were reasonable (though you have to study). Best physics professor I had in the 13x series.

I liked that fact that he used the chalkboard in the room we were in. Sometimes his explanations weren't so good, but he tried. The only thing I would say is that the tests were really hard and I didn't feel all that prepared. The final seemed like I was in the wrong room I was so confused/clueless on it.

He's a really good teacher... a busy man, so he doesnt have that much time for helping. If you follow his instuctions, and do the work he tells you to, you can do alright. I really struggled, but he was helpful. Definitly take from him- he's harder but a great teacher!

I struggled a lot in this class, but in the end I did really well. he's a really good teacher, and his lectures are interesting with all the demonstrations. Plus, he's VERY willing to help. I'm glad I had him.

This guy is really good.. knows his subject brilliantly... tries to make it as easy for the students as possible... makes his lectures interesting by always keeping an experiment or two for demonstration... exams are relatively easy.... DEFINITELY take his class
good
Dr. Schumacher was very fair and interesting.  I really learned a lot from his class and would definately recommend him.

This guy was pretty cool. His lectures were pretty interesting, which when you have 200 kids in an auditorium it can behard to lose interest.  He always had a prop or two to keep you awake. His midterm was easy and the final too. It will definitely help if you have some physics background as I got an A with moderate effort.  the labs were borin
Enthusiastic, fun, and helpful.  Does all he can to teach well.  Also, a very smart person.
Great professor.  Very clear in class.  Really ties in practical applications with the material in class.  Highly recommended.
One of my best profs. Hands down.

will have to work hard in class and keep up unless you're a genius.  very knowledgeable prof and seems willing to help (even though i never really utilized it).  don't ever assume anything about his tests or quizes because any hints he gives about what's on them means nothing, you must know everything to be safe. cool guy + he gave a curve i think

If you study well you should be able to pull a B with no problem.
very hard final....sometimes tests are totally irrelavent to classwork
Good lecturer, does a good job of explaining the difficult concepts of physics.
Very willing to help you outside of class. This class is tough if you aren't good at calculus.
He is very smart, funny at times, challenging but not too hard.  His cockiness was charming.  Overall he's a 110% teacher.  (M&J)
He's not a bad teacher, he's just arrogant.
Sometimes funny, often arrogant, always good teacher.

The class was taught extremely well and very clear. I was pleased with the professors ability to teach. The teacher told us information about previous classes that let us know what people usually messed up on. He did alot of experiments to reinforce the material. One of the best teachers I had.

Professor Schumacher is very knowledgable on the subject. The homework he assigns is worthless for exams, and recitation is very helpful. good teacher, bad handwriting, you'll like him even if you suck at physics
the class is hard, but he is very fair, and pretty cool as far as physics people go...
Awesome professor-loves what he teaches and it shows.  Very fair on grading-good lectures-willing to help students understand.
Very good teacher.  Lectures are fun and the midterms are very fair.  Loves his job and knows material inside and out.  Take him over Bolland if the choice arises.
If you can get past his cockiness, he's not a bad teacher. Smart as hell.
No Comments
This class is VERY easy to fall behind in!! Go to all the lectures. He is funny and makes lessons relatable and make sense in the real world. A good teacher in general.
Passionate professor, hard class. Syllabus says attendance not mandatory, but this professor holds TopHat assignments that make attendance mandatory.

Pierre was a great professor this semester. I enjoyed his lectures, as they were generally helpful, with example problems being done in class, as well as examples of real world applications and demos. Attendance is taken via Tophat questions during lecture, and the questions are a good gauge of if you are understanding the lecture.

The sweetest, funniest German man who genuinely wants you to do well. Quizzes were taken directly from the extremely helpful Class demos. Used the class puppies in his demos. Always agrees when his students voice concerns. Don't be fooled, difficult class. I worked my butt off for hours a day to get the grade I did.

In lecture he made every effort to make things interesting for the students. At the same time however, he would often make mistakes doing calculations in class and come up with the wrong numbers. There were no answer keys for the questions that he would complete in lecture so this often made things really confusing. Nice but disorganized.
Klaus was a very good professor he was always funny and very sweet. The content is not that hard. If you have to take physics 1200 I highly recommend him.
Such a great guy and also one of the funniest professors I've ever had. Would highly recommend taking him.

Klaus was great and funny! His lectures are entertaining and he communicates the subject matter clearly. I had him as a recitation instructor as well and he is super easy to talk to and encourages asking questions. He also agrees with students that how the course is set up can be frustrating at times, so don't worry! He's on our side.

I love Dr. Hons! There's a lot of different criteria to balance out your grade. I got a D- on the first midterm and ended with an A, because the quizzes and 3 different types of homework helped balance it out. Super funny and entertaining demonstrations. He posts lectures to Carmen. I would recommend reading the book but its not required.

Honscheid is AWESOME! He  managed to make physics as fun and interesting as it can get.  He has great demonstrations and I found myself laughing out loud often  in his lectures.  Quizzes and exams are fair and all the info you need comes straight from his lectures. One of the best courses I have taken so far at OSU! Would definitely recommend!

Dr. Honscheid was an awesome professor.  He's probably as good as it gets for physics, exams and quizzes very fair.  Everything you need to know for exams comes straight from lecture and he presents the information in a very clear way.  I just wish that he taught 1201 as well
Dr. Honscheid was awesome! He made each lecture entertaining and gave great demonstrations. We had a a few sub lecturers and they were nowhere near as good as Klaus. Exams and quizzes were very fair.

The Physics is so easy that a lot of people didn't attend lecture, but he's a great lecturer! Tons of demonstrations, including some really cool ones like exploding a barrel with liquid nitrogen. Class was easy if you paid attention!
Klaus is amazing and I wish I could take him for 112/113! he makes lecture interesting and makes physics seem fun and easy.

AWESOME TEACHER!!! He actually managed to make it interesting. I almost failed taking it with another prof,(Smyser) but did well with him. I pretty much had ZERO previous interests in physics but his demos are fun and actually made me want to come to class!! HIGHLY RECOMENDED!!! :)
Great demonstrations

Let me preface with: I'm a smart, motivated Honors student. The one thing that kills me is unclear teachers who can't teach. This is DEFINITELY not one of them. Yes, he has cool demos. His midterm and final are tougher than I'd like to see from physics but not bad if you go to lecture. The homework is probably the hardest part about this class.

Klaus is an awesome guy, neat german accent (can understand him, though). He makes lectures fun with demos and such, but lecture does not have much substance. The material in 111 is snorezville (labs are boring!!) but if you get a chance to take klaus, do it. He's hilarious! One of my favorite profs here!

Great teacher.  Great experiments.  Did the problems on the board that you needed to help with homework, which he then used on the quizzes, and then used on the midterms and final.  If you do the book homework (not required), you should have no problem getting a high grade.

Let me preface with: I'm a smart, motivated Honors student. The one thing that kills me is unclear teachers who can't teach. This is DEFINITELY one of them. Yes, he has cool demos. BUT..his midterm, final and homework is hard specifically because he doesn't do thorough & clear problems on the board. Do NOT listen to previous comments!!
Super professor, really great and easy to follow; he's got ears like Dumbo, but hey is he cool!!
I loved Klaus! His demos were awesome and he really cared about what he was doing. Do your  own homework, and problems and you will be ok.

Klaus is an awesome lecturer! He did sweet demos almost every lecture and I actually looked forward to going to lecture. Klaus has a sense of humor and is very entertaining. He does lots of examples on the board to make the material easy to understand. Highly recommended!

Such an easy class!  The quizes and midterm are so much easier than the homework.  Quizes are also open homework.  Apparently he is the easiest teacher for 111, so take him for that reason alone.  Lecture is like a show, very enjoyable.
Great guy! Super helpful lectures, and really fun in-class experiments.

AWESOME PHYSICS TEACHER!! extremely goofy and clumsy, but really smart. he class was super easy. if u get the chance to take physics with him DO IT! read the book, go to lectures, and u'll get an A- at least
HE's the COOLEST TEACHER EVER!
Honscheid was a great professor.  He conveyed the material very effectively.

little tough to understand sometimes with his German accent.   final and exam are so easy.  i took the final (35 multiple choice and no show work) in about 45 minutes.  all plug in problems with no concept questions

All I have to say is WOW.  By the far the best physics professor ever.  His quizes are fairly easy but the midterm and the final were a joke.  If you are half awake in this class, you will learn a good amount and easily get an A.

Klaus is to physics what Jenna Jameson is to movies. In a word, GREAT. He has realistic expectations of what an average student will do and adjusts accordingly. Lectures are fun and make you think, and recitation with him helped tremendously. He is hilarious, both from his sense of humor and German accent. Quizzes and exams are fair and mostly easy

He is an amazing lecturer. Last day of class, he lit a rat on fire and blew up a balloon with it. I actually learn with him. He makes Physics interesting. Exams are fair. I learned the top 10 things not to do after Med school, well 9 b/c #6 was sensored by Harold. I looked forward to going to his lectures each time. Take this prof.

Anyone who has to take the physics 111-113 series needs to take it with this guy. He makes the class entertaining, is willing to help you and his tests and quizzes are fairly easy if you pay attention to his lectures. You may even get lucky enough to get him as your recitation teacher too, I did......it really helped me out.

TAKE THIS GUY!!  HIS EXAMS ARE EASY BECAUSE THEY COME FROM THE QUIZZES!!  The physics program at ohio state sucks with labs, quizzes, homeworks every week, but lets face it, you have to take the class!  Get honscheid though because he is a funny guy and really good at relaying the material to his students!  I got an A with no problems!
klaus is kool!

Take this guy.  Physics sucks because there is homework due online every week, a quiz every week, and lab almost every week.  There is one midterm and one final almost all multiple choice.  Honscheid is funny and made if fun.  I have Gramila for 112 and he sucks, so get Honscheid if you can.  Class is curved to a 78% as well.  I got an A.
He is funny.  He actually kept my attention in a physics lecture.  Take him!

Very good lecturer, has a german accent but he is not difficult to understand.  His demonstrations and his personality almost make it fun going to a physics class. I would definatley recommend taking Physics with this guy if you have the option.
klaus is the man
Great prof. and awesome demonstrations. Really keeps the student interested!
Very fun teacher, his demos are great, just remember... aim for the monkey!

Good teacher! Very funny!  You'll want to go to his lectures just to see what crazy experiment he'll do next.  The physics is a little hard, so def. do your homework and go to Recitation.  He also has a german accent, but it's not too hard to understand him.
He made going to class fun....i never missed a lecture...tests are fair....fun guy...take him if possible!!
He is so fun! He actually made going to lecture interesting.  He was hilarious and energetic, and made some of the most dull material interesting.  Great teacher!
Absolutely hysterical, and a wonderful teacher. Kind and helpful, and my favorite part of the whole class...i met my fiancee.
he's so cool and fun! Him and Howard are like the odd couple, lol. He's so excited about physics, it makes lectures a blast.
fun teacher, very fair, easy class and i had a great time.

Avoid the physics dept at all costs.

Bro email your counselor as soon as you can if you get his class. I have no f*cking idea why he calls himself a professor. He gives "lectures" opens his documents and just doddles. Like WTAF. He does not know how to communicate properly and sometimes he will throw extra stuff at you which not explaining properly confuses you even more.

Dr Barrett is the worst lecturer Ive had at OSU so far. He either refuses to answer questions or provide further explanation during lecture, or answers them condescendingly. I dont think he cares about any of his students. Definitely review other physics materials outside of his class - you wont learn the content from his lectures.
Hes pretty mmmmmnkay

Dr. Barrett isnt as bad as everyone makes him seem, but I agree that he doesnt give enough practice resources. The key to his class is rewatching lectures and making sure you understand exactly how to do every single example he shows, and also how to do all the (very difficult) homework problems. If you have to, go to office hours.

His lectures are hard to follow and he barely explains anything, yet told us not to use the textbook because he didn't like it. He offers NO problem sets, practice quizzes, or any additional work which makes it near impossible to learn physics. When you ask questions you'll probably get a sarcastic or condescending comment as an answer.

Totally agree with other students comments. Tough person and rude. Never really trying to help. When I asked a question that he simply dont know to ask, he just gave me a mmmanyy sound as if its my fault. Worst professor Ive met.

Dr. Barrett may be hard sometime and he also may be hard to reach out outside the class. I was hoping I couldve chosen another session. Hopefully, he kind of change his way after the second exam. Overall, its a fine class but I would only recommend to take it if you can deal with his sometimes hard grading.
Would not recommend it.
Was a little painful to catch up with the materials and hard to keep a good grade. Fortunately, things became easy A and accessible in the last few weeks of the semester.
One of the worst professor you can find at OSU without giving you feed backs and answering your question.
Awful and useless.
Terrible teacher that shouldnt be teaching at all. Unwilling to help. Never really answer your questions. Hes shouldnt be teaching if hes not gonna be teaching!
Act as if hes the smartest guy in the room and every other people are idiot
Terrible person

Terrible human being in general. Rude and sarcastic, doesnt help. I have him as my recitation instructor, and he insults people and doesnt help, instead making fun of them for not being able to learn what hes known for years. On multiple occasions is very rude to me, and makes he hate having to attend his recitation/lab. Beware having him.

Dr. Barrett's lectures, despite the mmnnayy's, are helpful. He can skip over the key point that you're missing to understand a type of problem, and his slideshows are trash. It would have been a good idea to record his lectures because a lot of time the important information is just said rather than both said and written. Straightforward tests.
Lectures do not correlate to material tested on. Extremely unclear on expectations of knowledge. Unhelpful and provided very few additional resources to do well in his class.
Dr. Barrett can be very rude and unhelpful when you need help. If you are doing something wrong in lab he will simply make a meh sound and then walk away. I would not recommend him to anyone.

Tom Barrett can be summed up by one phrase: MMMnyayyy. He is a great lecturer, but his quizzes and exams are difficult. Don't sit in the front or else he will definitely bring you in on his jokes. His signature is making an obviously wrong mistake as a joke, then calling on anyone in the front thats laughing and being like "whats so funny?"
Get used to hearing his patented catchphrase : Mnayyyyyyyyyyyyy.

He's an okay guy outside of class, and makes lame-ish jokes to be cool. It's admirable, but he's also just so arrogant in many regards. 1-2 page papers every other week isn't bad, nor are the group projects. But his feedback is nonexistent and you're on your own to figure out what he wants from you.

Never was really a good explainer and was a very difficult grader. if a decimal place was off you automatically lost 50 percent even if every step before then was correct. when asked basically tells you well tough Im in charge. Thinks he is hilarious but not even close. would not reccomend

Professor is a generous title given to him in this course. There are 2-3 page research essays every 2 weeks and 3 major presentations throughout the course and not much in between. For the papers he just gives incredibly vague feedback and forget about it on the presentations. I still didn't know what he was looking for by the end of the semester.
The best Barrett at tOSU. His 8 am lectures were interesting enough that I didn't fall asleep in any of them. He really cares about physics and his students learning about it.

Barrett knows the insides and outsides of physics. He always comes to lecture extremely prepared. There is no faltering when he speaks. His strongest aspect as a lecturer is that he knows how to convey information in an understandable manner to students. His knowledge even goes beyond the material of the class. Also, he always cracks physics jokes!

He is overall a good lecturer. You might have to study some concepts he gives online to better understand the material, but he does a good job explaining most of the material. It is hard to take notes from his lectures and he doesn't post anything online so you should definitely go to class consistently all semester.

Do not take this class. no feedback given on papers or presentations besides brief, vague comments from a prof that just wants you to take his opinion as fact and nothing else. Wouldn't recommend this prof to anyone, or the class. got the writing credit, other than that a waste of time.

Overall, Dr. Barrett was a great professor. He is awkward and has a hard time answering questions.. most physics guys do. Tests and quizzes were very fair, besides maybe one or two multiple choice questions that were very odd and off track. Take him, he will be much easier than other Physics professors.

An overall average professor. Don't skip class--the things he says in lecture generally show up as multiple choice on the exams (which are worth 5 points each.) Previous physics knowledge and yahoo answers will help on homework. Labs are participation points.

Barrett is a great professor - provided that you know the material beforehand. With minimal effort I got a B, because I knew most subjects before. He likes to ramble a little, and is completely unaware that he says "nyehh" after every sentence. Free response questions are very easy because you can write down some formulas and get over half credit.

Do not take physics 2367 with barrett and wilkins if you care about your GPA. The course consists of writing a short paper every 2 weeks and giving 3 presentations over the semester. The presentations are horrible, the class avg for all 3 presentations were between 64 66 percent. They don't tell you how they graded it or what you did wrong either.

Encourages class participation, approachable, ask questions in class and office hours, explains calculus application SO WELL!!! Attend class pay attention, talk with neighbors when he says so and you'll do well. Don't really have to get the text, since all info can be found online.

I had him as a T.A. for physics 1250 when my main lecturer was Relando Valdes-Aguilar. I found out he was a professor and started going to his lectures. That was my greatest decision, I started going to lectures again and enjoyed them. He is a little intimidating in his way of teaching but it's to make sure you know the material well.

He is very clear. It isn't really mandatory to attend every class. I would suggest going to 75% of them but missing one is not a big deal. If you do skip, realize you will not understand the webassign homework problems  but with some work you can find all that you need in the book. Also, make sure you do the homework without yahoo.

VERY tough class. Barret is easy to understand and speaks clearly but sometimes he just isn't specific enough on major concepts preferring to do examples rather than explain HOW to do the examples. The quizzes are fair but the midterms are TOUGH. The homework also gets quite grueling as the year goes on.
Don't do it. Find ANY other professor.

Not a good professor. Doesn't teach concepts at all, just does random example problems on the board from which he drifts around and may start a second problem just to explain part of the first problem. Confusing and kind of condescending. Only reason I passed was because I started copying the notes from a different lecturer's section and used book

He is an interesting guy, and spices up the lectures a good bit with humor and the such, but just isn't a fantastic teacher.  He didn't explain the concepts of physics well, he just explained how to do problems mostly.  Which leaves you to learn how to apply all of that to a real problem.  I like him as a person, but not an amazing professor.

He doesn't know how to teach very well. I have already planed another schedule to go to other professors lectures instead of his so i don't get left behind in this fast pace class. For students that have not taken physics in high school i recommend to get out of class as fast as possible

Lectures are very interesting and he does a good job relating it to engineering and other real world applications. He's direct and has optional practice material that is very helpful for midterms. Make sure to spend time studyingunderstanding concepts for final because one question can apply various concepts from course. Would take course again.
I enjoyed lectures. He makes class interesting and covers most of the material that we are tested on. The class is hard, but he is so straightforward about what we need to know to do well.

Barrett is a pretty good lecturer overall. He says things pretty clearly and has a practical approach to problems. However, if you have a question, don't expect a plain answer. I think he prefers to talk around the answer to let you think through it. That's all well and good, but sometimes it's frustrating. That being said, go to office hours.
Barrett is a good professor. Gives a lot of explanations and works problems in class which is very beneficial. Exams are not too difficult if you study the homework and prepare for the quizzes.

In college, you can't expect everything to be handed to you in a silver platter. While i only landed a B+ in this paper, i feel like it was my fault and not the professors. Study the material well and you should be fine. The subject matter is vague which was my downfall. Overall a decent class.

Missed more lectures than I went to. He likes to talk about life, some related to physics, some not. Quizzes are mostly equation-solving questions while lectures are very conceptual. Textbook helps if you skip, however it is very lengthy and not exceptional well written. He tells you what you need to know for quizzes and tested.

I really don't like this prof. If I had any chance, not taking him, I will run away from him as far as possible. He is the worst. Anything on his lectures, doesn't really related to what you will expect in quizzes and tests.
Lectures are stimulating, but should ask him questions if you are lost.

Most people have given Professor Barrett bad reviews, but I really enjoyed his class.   He always kept the lectures interesting with various cartoons or real-life applications.  I often attended office hours and he was always there to help his students.  His exams could be difficult at times, but the class was curved a decent amount.

Do you have Barrett and have you lost hope? I know I did. It's like he's intentionally trying to confuse you because he thinks it's funny that physics is hard. Fear not! I learned all of our content from lasseviren1 on YouTube. He goes through the exact same curriculum; the difference is that he knows how to explain things. He saved my grade.

He might be a little off-putting, but Barrett is a great professor. His personality kind of gets in the way of getting the answers to your questions, but lecture was clear and he knew his way around the material. Make sure to understand everything conceptually, as this is a big chunk of each exam. Definitely going to sign up for him for 1251.
He is not a good professor at all. I would NOT take his class again. Its pointless to show up to his office hours because he thinks you should already know how to do the problem.

Some people really don't like him, but I thought he was a great teacher. He does spend some lectures talking too long about a cartoon or current event sort of related to the topic. BUT he did in fact do a lot of examples and had the class do problems solo or with their neighbor and then vote as a class for the answer to get immediate feedback.

I don't know why everyone here has had a bad time with him. I took his 1251 course over the summer and it was pretty good. He keeps class relatively fun and his exams aren't tricky as long as you do the homework and practice problems. I read every chapter from the book and did all the homeworkpractice problems so that helped. Good teacher.
Once you lost focus in the class you were screwed. He loves to go on tangents that are unhelpful and make the tests exceedingly hard.

Barrett is the worst professor I've ever had. He can't explain the material well, so you end up depending heavily on the book, which isn't that good in the first place. He wastes class time by making irrelevant jokes & giving long discourses on non-physics topics (like the weather) instead of teaching physics. Information density in class is low.

I have a different professor, but go to Barret's lectures over my own. He is awesome! LOVE his way of teaching, always fun in the lecture. He doesn't do many example problems, but shows a clear big picture of the concepts and how they are applied compared to other 1251 profs who explain material literally only using integrals =\ Take Barret!

Lectures were boring. He would talk about a cartoon for a majority of lecture and do ONE problem to only never give us the answer to it. Lectures were never helpful in homework, labs, or quizzes. Study a ton for his exams because they are very tricky, especially the multiple choice where I lost a lot of points on exams.
Terrible teacher, lectures are useless and he is not very helpful in office hours. Drop this class or you will be driven crazy by his excessive use of the phrase "mNay"
Terrible experience, avoid him test & quiz average are in the "D- F" range, critizes if you ask questions.

Avoid him if you can. His lectures are confusing. He expects you to know too much prior to class. His quizzes are tricky. I had to go to another lecturer because he was that bad. He also barely answers his email. I only succeeded in class from prior knowledge in high school. AVIOD HIM.

Lectures are practically useless. He has told me multiple times to just put down my pencil and listen. Quizzes and exams do not match what is taught in lecture. He does not finish in-class examples.  And the only reason I have done well is due to prior knowledge from high school. AVOID!

I have had a hard time even coming in with experience from high school. Many students attend lectures from other professors because his aren't helpful. He never finishes examples in class & expects students to know too much coming in. He acknowledges that he gets bad reviews and jokes about getting "stuck" with him again for 1251. Avoid if possible

Don't bother with his lectures. Terrible professor. Follow book chapters, and do homework. If you can understand the homework and do it, quizzes will be cake. Exams are around same level, maybe slightly easier than quizzes.

He does a good job of explaining things, but his exams are a lot harder than they need to be for an intro physics course. Averages on midterms and the final were in the 50s/60s. Double check your multiple choice answers, as you will lose the majority of points them, rather than the "show work" problems.

He teaches very advance, and assumes lots of things and do not explain clearly. Tests are hard, he would put just one question from homework, the rest he'll come up with questions that you have never seem before. If you are really into physics and you have good background, you'll do fine. Otherwise take another guy if you can.

Seriously hated this guy. He was an okay lecturer but his tests were way too hard. Overall I think his only problem was that the difficulty of his exams didn't match the quality of his lectures, making this class awful. If you can, switch to a different lecture so you don't get this sad excuse for a professor. Mmkay.
This dude is wack. Do everything you can to switch if you get him. He is beyond terrible. I don't know why he still teachs. He be in class like mmkaayy... wake up guys, he's not helpful.

His exams are insanely difficult, even compared to other professors' exams. When students do poorly on them, he gets disappointed as if it's our fault. No one has ever been prepared for his exams because the questions are ridiculously difficult. He is smart and seems like a good person outside of school, but DO NOT take him for physics.

Nothing he teaches is actually relevant to what he gives in the quizzes and exams. None of the questions asked stimulate thinking. Worst of all, he is against using intuitive methods to go about Physics. If you get him don't panic; drop out or change your professor before its too late. Or you will get what you don't deserve.

This guy is awful. Never explains how to do problems, but still expects you to know how to do them. The exams are out to trick you every time. The multiple choice are nearly impossible to get through. He makes you feel suicidal when people do bad and its really his fault
Honestly the worst professor I've had at college.  Examples in class are not related to quizzes, homework, or exams.  Talks down to students and rarely clarifies any questions.

Tom Barrett is without a doubt the worst professor i have ever had.  All he says is "mmmnay".  One class he said "mmmmnay" 96 times.  Not only is he a terrible teacher, he also makes you want to kill yourself.  If you find out you have him, drop the class while you can, mmnay?

Barrett is a terrible teacher. If you have any chance to, you NEED to avoid him. He briefly scratches the surface on all topics, and tells you not to write things down and basically read the book cover to cover. Some topics on quizzes and exams are NOT covered in class, and just are in the book.

Professor Barrett is one of the worst professors you could possibly get. I'm sure he's a great side outside the classroom, but he has absolutely no idea how to teach. Even though he doesn't teach you anything, he still expects you to know how to do the most difficult problems on midterms and quizzes. If you get stuck with him, I suggest dropping.

Worst teacher I've had here. His exams are so hard, he puts problems on that he doesn't spend a minute of time explaining. Definitely switch out if you are unlucky enough to get him. And hope you have a good TA if not...

Unhelpful and misleading with what he teaches, because his quizzes and exams are abstract from what he teaches.  He says its all about the "technique" to solving a problem, yet the graded material of the course does not reflect that agenda at all.
He did difficult exam.And his class is boring.Hope you not choose him
Most useless professor I've had so far.

If you can avoid him, do so, you'll thank yourself later. While his exams aren't impossible, he does a poor job of preparing you for them, and sometimes he likes to throw in questions that involve strategies he never taught.  He's also little to no help if you ask him a question.  If you end up with him, pray you have a good TA.

If you end up with this professor SWITCH OUT or see the tutors in Smith ASAP. During lectures he frequently goes off on tangents about higher level physics which is confusing. If you haven't taken Physics before (or just a basic Physics course in High School), you will struggle. Midterms and Final Exam averages were around a 50-60%.

If you can avoid taking him DO.  Lectures are more than useless, and in lecture he does absolutely nothing but talk in circles, and do one or two easy examples.  Nothing compared to what his midterms are like.  Also he makes you feel stupid for asking questions.  Personally, I would never want to take his class again.

Absolutely terrible teacher, if he truly deserves the title of "teacher". Spends no time in class actually teaching, he does maybe 1 or 2 examples with students in class and he does them usually half way and moves on. He also thinks he is HILARIOUS and laughs at all of his poor jokes. We watch cartoons most of class, and we don't learn anything.

Tom can be fun at times. He gets caught up in his examples and by the end its hard to see where he was going with it. He thinks of good examples but he also discourages writing things down. All in all this is a boring class but he isn't the worst physics teacher I've had either.

I thought Tom was very good at explaining abstract concepts. I skipped a few lectures but I never had to open by textbook, and did fairly well on all the quizzes, and the midterm and final. He tells bad jokes that are funny because of how bad they are. I wasn't very good at physics and he definitely helped me a lot.

Dr. Barret is an average to good professor. While you may not learn much from lecture, this is true of any class that one must study a considerable amount outside of class. He is often unhelpful at office hours, but this is simply because if you learn the material yourself, you will remember it better. His exams are somewhat hard  but consistent.

Lectures are a waste of time. Just read the book, you'll learn more. Kind of talks down to students who ask questions in office hours (pretty uncomfortable). Quizzes are fairly difficult but exams are pretty hard. He gives a study guide that i WOULD STRONGLY RECOMMEND doing. His jokes are ok but could do without. Can tell he is bored with class.
Not a great teacher.  Tells his students not to right down anything because "it's in the book".  Lectures don't help with the homework or midterms.
Tom really enjoys teaching.  He brings jokes to class and he is very interactive.  Everything you need to know is covered in lecture.
great instructor. not much help with the homework, youre going to need the textbook. tests are hardish but he really helps you grasp the concepts

Barret teaches his classes in a way that forces the students to be involved and to try the material on their own. I bet the students who give him a bad review are the students that are afraid to learn by themselves and don't realize that the professor is just there to give help and to guide them when they need it. (help does not = free answer)

He knows what he's doing, but it's clear when he got his teacher tenure, he stopped trying. He doesn't explain things very well, and God help you if you have a question, because Barrett certainly won't help you. He'll happily berate your lack of knowledge though. =] Seriously though, avoid him unless you enjoy being verbally abused frequently.
Great Professor, good explanations, finds ways to relate physics to things outside the class room, funny guy, all around a great professor!

A very good lecturer. I do not know why he receives those bad ratings. He explains everything crystally clear, willing to help the students, and the quizzes arent hard. An extra point: he is funny. Do not skip class because if you understood his lectures already, you dont even need to open your textbook anymore. Take him!
I thought he was pretty funny and explained the concepts really well

Overall, I liked Tom as a professor. I felt like he explained the concepts well in class and went over a lot of example problems. His practice exams were usually harder than the actual  ones, so if you did those, understood the concepts well, and knew what types of problems to expect on the exam, you could do fine.

Barrett is a bad choice for anyone without previous physics experience. He treats all work as though you know how to do it beforehand and therefore teaching is kind of up to yourself. I'd recommend Steigman if you are a first time physics taker or non-engineer like myself. Overall Barrett is pretty much useless. Tests are also hard in comparison.

Physics 131 was easy with Barrett. Go to lecture and do the homeworks and you'll do well on his quizzes/midterm. Kind of annoying with the "nn-yay" but an A is an A, and the students who don't show up get punished pretty hard and create a nice curve.
This Professor is joke.. He uses powerpoint for lecture(physics). he doesn't finish examples. I would suggest that you avoid this guy in all cost.

Tom Barrett is a garbage teacher.  He is a very rude person in general.  He thinks he is the king of the world or something.  He always says "Neah" all the time.  I guarantee you will get annoyed by it eventually.  The class wasn't really that hard though.  He isn't very helpful if you want to ask him a question.  He basically trys to belittle you.

Tom Barrett is hit and miss for some. His lectures are very dull and disengaging. He is not the most helpful in office hours either. However, his tests are very reasonable and if the material is understood you can get by without lecture. Good TAs are very helpful as well.

Honestly, Dr. Barrett has an undeserved bad reputation.  While I agree the OSU physics dept is one of the worst in the univesity, his lectures are straightforward and he doesn't test you on material not covered in class.  Google physics 133 and work some of Dr. Steigman's problems and it's an easy A.

One of the worst professors I have had here, even worse than the rest of the pathetic physics department. His lectures are boring and useless. He is horrible at talking to groups and has an incredibly annoying tick where he says mkay about 50 times per lecture.  His only saving feature is that he is lazy, so he reuses old midterms identically.

Barrett, for starters, is a terrible teacher. His jokes aren't funny, his examples aren't helpful, and his quizzes/tests are impossible unless you sleep with your physics book nightly. Halfway through I stopped going to lecture and just reading the book, which will teach you A LOT  more than what he can. AVOID.
Terrible experience
Agree with last 4 comments above. Terrible experience

H ABSOLUTELY BLOWS! HIS LECTURES R USELESS AND HIS EXAMS/MIDTERMS/QUIZZES CONTAIN MUCH MORE DIFFICULT PROBLEMS THAN THE EASY BULLSHIT HE COVERS IN CLASS WHICH BY THE WAY U COULD LEARN BETTER BY JUST READING THE TEXTBOOK

Do not take Tom Barrett.....run the other way now...please...this guy ruined my interest in physics and disgraces the ohio state university...he gets a sick twisted pleasure out of making tests way harder than other professors just to see his students do bad...trust me..avoid him at all costs

Seemed ok at first, but about halfway through the quarter, his true colors showed. He is pompous, and looks down on students who don't understand rather than trying to help. Quizzes can come out of left field and have questions not covered by homework or lecture. My TA was terrible also, so it was a double whammy.  I recommend a different professor

worst professor I've had so far. Lecture is completely useless. He throws the formulas which you can get from the book. He only goes over 1-2 examples a day, when the quizzes cover that much in 15 mins. He also teaches out of order from the book. Not very helpful via email (always replied in one word).Very disappointed overall, makes phys difficult

TERRIBLE. Lectures were full of stupid jokes and useless cartoons. It would have been helpful to see some application, after all we are SCIENCE and ENGINEERING majors. We need to know what we're doing, why we're doing it, and HOW to do it.  He definitely falls short on that last one.  100% USELESS.

I don't know what everyone is talking about.  He is really good, tests are so simple/obvious give away answers.  Very little work inside and outside of class.  A very pleasant experience overall.  Oh, and he has really stupid yet hilarious jokes.
I really enjoyed his lectures and he was very helpful after hours.
His lecturers aren't really helpful. You have a better chance if you don't have him as your TA.
Terribly uninteresting as a lecturer. I would recommend skipping his lectures and going to a different one, it will do you more good.
Typical arrogant thinks-he-knows-it-all professor.
Great environment for anybody enthusiastic about physics.  I had him as my recitation instructor as well and he was extremely helpful.
lectures are absolutely pointless -does not help you with anything - gets off topic very easily - quizzes/midterms are impossible.
Likes to teach and is helpful overall
extremely corny, but a very good teacher/explainer.

Ive had Tom for all three classes of the physics series. The first time I had him I severly disliked him. After having him a second time I realized  why people dislike him, and why he is actually a very good prof/TA. He makes you think about the problem, he doesnt just give you the answer, you have to ask questions which direct you to the solution.

I was told by a friend not to have him as AT,who looked at this site before the quarter started, I didnt want to because if i didnt i would have had a fri lab...SHOULD HAVE TAKEN THE FRI LAB...he is that bad no joke

Wow, what a terriable guy.  He is physco. When you try to get help, he'll just get pissed you dont get it. When grading tests he takes off points that NO other teacher should/would in fact the Physics dep had to recollect teasts after he graded them because he did such a bad job. DO NOT EVEN TAKE HIM!!!

Please do not ruin your quarter with this guy. He really is terrible. He lives and breathes Physics and thinks you should already know what to do. He will tell you to buy his book to help you. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. He is a prick.
Knows what he's doing.  Very helpful outside of class.
terrible teacher who thinks he is better than the students and doesn't help very much
thinks he's better than you, mkay
not a bad teacher.   quizzes and tests are tricky and you have to think your way through them.  total jerk though.  went to ask him for help and he basically yelled at me.

This guy seems nice at first, but as the class progresses one realizes that his attitude is one of a smug, unhelpful and discourteous professor who has a chip on his shoulder from when he was picked on back in high school. He knows the stuff but cannot impart that knowledge effectively but does have an aura of snide indifference.
He has really high expectations for you as a student just learning this material.  He talks down to you if you dont understand, and makes snide remarks during class.
This guy deserves a stupid rating.
Tests were impossible, midterm 1 was horrible, and the final was impossible, AVOID AT ALL COSTS
No Comments

i think as long as you show him that you tried the problem, then asking him what you are doing wrong, he will help you out. he really wants YOU to figure it out. so if you have no idea what you're doing, then he'll make you cry, like i did.

crystal clear. i felt like i had 100% comprehension and got and A before the curve. i think the reason most people dont like him is the teaching style. if you really pay attention and follow along and actually think about what he is saying you will get an A too.
No Comments
I don't usually dislike any teachers, but this man is just a smug prick.  If you have him, be sure you have a really good TA, because you won't learn much of anything from him.
good

The biggest prick I have ever had a a professor. Some People may think he is cool b/c he is just their professor, but I have the guy as my TA as well..His entire recitation, he expects everyone to fully understand everything from his lectures, and makes smartass comments to those who do not..He treats students eerily like they are High Schoolers

He tries to be funny in class but lets face it the dude has a PhD in physics. His class is not that helpful b/c he doesnt get to many examples its all concepts. The midterms and final did reflect what you learn in class. Go to class and you should be fine.

He tries but I think he's just socially inept.  Try to ask him for help and you'll be greeted with a "you're an idiot" attitude.  I got an A but, it was because of my TA (Justin Link is awesome) and a lot of self study.
He is nice and tries to be funny, but he strictly follows procedure. Go to class and pay attention. If you can get a 100% on all the webassign problems you will get an A.
No Comments
Unhelpful, Makes vaguely ****/**** comments during lecture. Acts as if students should know material before taking the course.

Seemed nice, although i only went to 5 lectures.  Tests are tricky, some multiple choice questions were clearly designed to trick people, but once you figured out his thought process, it wasn't too bad.

Class was easy, not necessarily because of Tom. He uses a lot of examples to make the material easy to understand--not that it isn't already. You shouldn't even need to go to class to get an A in this one.

He is HORRIBLE!! When I asked him a question that I didn't even know where to start.  He said:"Think about what you've learned" Since I had no idea I asked again after 10 min.  He said:"I don't appriciate that you ask me before you even try"  Guess what, Bit*h!! If I know how to do it or figure it out without asking you I wouldn't have been here!

easy class. i think he makes tests that are harder than other professors, but i had a strong background in the material (from high school) so i am doing ok. he does not seem rude or anything like others say, but i sit way in the back of the lecture hall and i have not talked to him one on one.
Makes highly inappropriate comments during lectures and seems to take pleasure in administering unnecessarily difficult exams. This guy needs to learn a thing or two from the other instructors.

Easiest class ever, and to top it off, my classmate were idiots.  This got me tons of bonus pts and an A for the class.  I would not recommend Barret though, the class was easy, but not because of him.  I recommend Dr. Doty for this course.

Rumor has it Tom likes to take students to COAM with no basis. Terrible teacher, very unapproachable when you have questions, terrible class etiquette, favors students, and blacklists others. Tom constantly gets off topic and gives more information than could ever be fathomed. RUN FAST THE OTHER WAY

Somewhere between his dumb jokes and unintentional racial remarks, Tom Barrett is supposed to be teaching physics. His teaching is just as bad as his humor. He gets kicks outta his students averaging 41 percent on exams. I say dump his ass!

terrible!! class avg. on 1st midterm was 50%!.. did not lecture material well.. did not review before tests.. explained it was normal for students to fail the tests.  made rude and **** jokes in lecture, made test questions nearly impossible to answer, some with no answer possible! avoidatallcost!

Tom Barrett has no place in the classroom where he can interact with students.   I really think the material in this course was fascinating but Barrett ruined my experience.  Barrett seems to get some kind of twisted pleasure out of seeing his students fail, and told us that we would.

i had a good experience in this class, but found him a little odd and lacking in self-confidence.  OF COURSE i have a history of liking physics professors which no one else likes, and i loved the material in this course.

If you like to be insulted, barked at, lied to, and unfairly graded then you'll love Barrett. WORST human being I've ever met. This guy made the class 100X harder than it had to be. I don't have enough space to fully explain just how bad he was. Very rude. Very opinionated. Very unclear. Very BAD!
He is way too full of himself and thinks he is always right. He puts problems on quizes and tests that he admittely said we were going to get wrong. Even our TA hated him! BAD!!
Very good professor. He is a good guider on the labs. The only drawback is that the lectures are not clear enough.

Mr. Leonard is a great professor. The Physics 3700 course in the summer term is only four weeks long, and the pace is fast. Still, Richard takes good care of every student and is very patient to ensure that every student can complete the experiment successfully. The only drawback is that the rhythm lectures were a little messy.
Dr. Leonard is an angel professor. He takes care of every student. He teaches students who have difficulties in the lab hand-by-hand. The only minor flaw is that the lectures are not clear enough.

Richard Leonard is the best choice for Physics 3700. He is a very responsible professor, and his students will have a good teaching experience. His lecture may not have been clear enough, but it was not incomprehensible. All in all, Richard is a worthy professor!

Richard is excellent! He took me hand in hand to finish the experiment, before which I was a fragile student. His grades are very reasonable, and there is a bottom mechanism, as long as the completion of the experiment or the worst homework can get 80% of the score. Moreover, he pays attention to the course process, and his curriculum has no final.

Richard is a great professor! He organizes the class very well. He patiently teaches students to complete the experiment hand in hand and ensures that the student's problems are solved no matter how difficult. It would be perfect if his lectures were more transparent, but the defects would not prevent him from being a respectable professor!

I highly recommend Dr. Leonard! He gave me a firm grasp of the statistics necessary for physics and astronomy and the required experiments. Although my experimental ability was initially fragile, under Richard's patient teaching, I successfully mastered the experimental method. The only drawback was that his lecture was not clear enough.

Dr. Leonard is one of my favorite and most admired professors. His store of knowledge is very thick. He sets the pace of the course reasonably. Under Richard's guidance, we can complete the 14-week course in 4 weeks at a fast pace to keep up with the class progress and absorb the experimental skills and statistical knowledge we should have.

I like Dr. Leonard. He takes good care of every student. The experiments in Physics 3700 are challenging, but Richard patiently solves every student's difficulty. Physics 3700 in summer is a fast-paced class that lasts only four weeks, but Richard allows me to get good grades and absorb the knowledge of physics experiments.

Richard comes across as a kind grandfather. He takes good care of every student and will work hand in hand with students who have difficulty in the experiment to carry out the steps to ensure they can complete it. He interestingly organized the courses without making them difficult. The grade mainly consists of homework and lab work, with no exams.

Highly recommended professors, especially during the summer semester! His lectures are well organized and clear in content. Although the lab part is not strongly related to the lecture, it is not difficult to get started. To go to Physics 3700, go to Richard!

Very nice professor. He organized the class very well, and the time in class could be fully utilized. All the tasks could be completed in class, so there was no need for too much time after class. lab requires a certain degree of proficiency in computer operation, and Richard is very careful to teach students how to do well in lab.

The professor is very good, although the lecture and the experiment have little correlation, but each can learn a lot. The homework and quiz are very easy, as long as you listen to the lecture carefully, it is easy to score. lab requires some computer proficiency, but not afraid, Richard will walk you through the lab hand in hand.

Very good professor. Lectures are clear, tasks can be solved in class, and there is no need for too much time after class. The experiment is carried out on a computer and requires some proficiency in some software applications, but Richard will personally guide you through the course!
Very solid professor! He takes great care of the students and teaches them how to complete the experiment hand in hand. Following his command, the class will be a breeze!
Dr. Leonard is a nice guy and he reminds me of my grandpa. However, I have to say he doesn't explain anything well. This whole course could have been organized better.

I took his class alongside a real stats class. Nothing was explained well in Dr. Leonard's. Taught straight from a  difficult text and topics were covered poorly. Labs consisted of stumbling to the answer from trial/error. Grades were entirely based on the final as every assignment could be resubmitted until 100%, and he used the final to crush us.

There is no correlation between the labs and the homework, and he does absolutely no teaching, opting instead to assign lots of reading.  He then takes book problems and, with no explanation, uses his own symbols and derivations etc. Unnecessarily confusing.

Accepts late work, but that won't help you on the final. 

Avoid if at all possible.
The homework he arranges is never clear. Fortunately, I have taken a statistics course, and after that course, get ready to do lab work for at least six hours a week and still cannot get good grades

I've never had a more understanding prof when it comes to late work, just an all around very kind and knowledgable prof who wants to see his students do well and comprehend the material. He's very accessible, whether it be discussion boards, email, or office hours. Attendance was never mandatory.

He's just a nice guy, in a grandpa way. he's very straightforward with material and the problems he is going to give on exams. the practice problems in the book and extended response at the end of the chapters were essentially the quizzes (which he says). the exams all had a generous curve, as well as the final. the final was pretty tough.

Dr. Leonard is the best teacher for this course. He's upfront about what he expects from the students as well as what's on the quizzes and exams. A fair portion of the questions on assessments were word for word from the Misconception or recitation demo problems. He wants his students to do well and provides them with the tools for it.

80% of people were not going to lecture by the third week of class. Lectures were useless and dry. He goes off on tangents that will not help you with understanding the material. Says he goes over possible quiz problems in class but never actually works them out. Read the textbook and do whatever you have to do to learn the material on your own.

Great professor - if you eager to learn a dnsrop by his office hours. Never had issues to stop by his office and ask questions. Great on replying emails with questions. Very clear on what will be on exams ( do chapter problems and you will be fine)

He grades the homework 2 months after receiving it. and grades them at once and destroy your total grade at once with nonsensical ruthless grading . He does not understand the idea of learning from your mistakes and the idea of gradual learning . Beware!!!

Professor Leonard, contrary to most of the surprisingly bad reviews, was an extremely helpful person in class. Whenever students had questions or concerns, he was patient, clear, and concise, making sure that we actually learned the material. Make sure that you ask for help consistently and come to class often so you understand the material well.
