This is a super hard class that everyone hates and Zeke does the best he can with the hard material! Quizzes fairly easy but exams are impossible! Pray to God you get a good TA because they make or break this class.

Don't be fooled by the low rating, he's a great professor. His notes are easy to follow and he is willing to stop and clear up any problems you may be having. Attendance isn't mandatory but recommended as you will cover concept questions in class that will reappear on quizzes and exams. I had friends in the other classes and Zeke was clearly better

Amazing professor. If you understand the concepts he explains in class you won't have a problem doing well on the quizzes and exams. Clearly explains even the most abstract concepts and keeps lectures interesting with concept questions and demos. Attendance isn't mandatory but I would encourage everyone to go if you want to get above a C-/B+.
He cares so much about his students!!!! he doesn't always explain concepts the best in lecture, but if you go to him for explanations he is happy to help. His quizzes/exams are straight forward.

Contrary to a lot of the other review's here, I think Dr. Johnston-Halperin was an alright professor. At least from what I could tell from my semester with him, he seemed to genuinely care about his students. He could be unprepared and make mistakes from time to time, as others have said, but he really worked on taking feedback this year.

The teacher often wasted 15% of the lectures going off topic on research or non-physics related activities. The notes were too conceptual and did not prepare students for tests. The teacher also had concept questions which were only seen in lecture due to "copyright infringements", and they were Always on quizzes and tests. Basically memorization.

Lectures are incredibly boring. Expect for their to be mistakes on tests and quizzes. The final had a question on it that had no possible answer because the question was written incorrectly.  Went to class around 8 times over the semester and ended with an A- after getting a low seventy on the first midterm a 88 on the second midterm and 85 final.

The first 20 minutes of each lecture was spent correcting mistakes made in the previous lecture. Exam questions were unlike any in the homework. This professor goes out of his way to be unhelpful - refuses to post any homework or quiz solutions or practice exams.

I'm sure he's great at whatever research he does, but giving clear lectures with correct information is not his strong suit. Be sure to read the book to actually get correct information and to understand material. It's still advisable to go to class because he goes over multiple choice concept questions that show up on testsquizzes.

You could tell he was new to lecturing and teaching undergrad physics. There were times he seemed unprepared by writing concept questions with incorrect or disputable answers. Several times in class his material was questioned and he had to make corrections in response which made lectures very hard to follow. Easy test questions though.
Worst teacher I've ever had.. Lectures are not clear whatsoever and makes many mistakes with the material. Highly dont recommend taking him if you have the option

Dr. Johnston-Halperin seemed very nice and extremely knowledgeable the two times that I saw him.  It may have just been an off semester because of weather, or he may have had other things going on, but Dr. JH was sort of an absentee professor. He provided no instruction or feedback, and did not grade the lab  reports (50% of grade) until finals.

Dr. Johnston-Halperin is nice, but also doesn't seem to care for undergrads. His class is run with no feedback. You have to learn everything from the book. Students don't know how they are doing, and if they understood material or not until it's too late. He barely lectured, and didn't help with homework. He took over 9 weeks to return papers.

He is awful, you cannot even reach via email or phone. He ignores emails all the time. He was the worst professor I have ever had in my entire life. Im so glad that Im done with him. He also didnt let me pass one letter with 0.01%. Awful...

The Class itself is fine if you don't have him or other notably bad professors, but he is incredibly condescending when you reach out to him regarding any issues you may need to contact him for. I seriously haven't been more disappointed in how a professor conducts him/herself, zero compassion

"if you think you have a conflict because you have two of more final exams the same day, that is not a conflict, that is bad luck."

I'm directly quoting an announcement he made before the finals. this is the type of guy you would be dealing with. And I'm very certain his reaction to this review will reflect the same condescending attitude.
This is the worst instructor I've ever had. He is not caring about anything whatsoever. He is arrogant, condescending, and patronizing. How this man has a job is beyond me.
Literally would rate him a 0 if I could. He was extremely rude when I had a conflict with the final exam. It was like I was emailing a five year old. Grow up.

No class organization. Had problems with a group member for lab and after being directed to him he told me he basically didnt care. Wouldnt let someone I know change exam times due to emergency circumstances. Avoid this dude at all costs.

Not a very friendly guy. He doesn't seem to care about his students at all, even the ones that are willing to learn and ask questions. He was pretty passive aggressive, too. His lectures were boring and the class in general has a lot of homework. Be ready to make friends or work with the TA if you want to learn and do well.

Some professors aim to watch others succeed, usher a new generation of students who will contribute to society, be excited to learn and better themselves, and excel at the thing theyre being taught. Others do it for the pay and prestige. They do not care about their students lives or understanding of the material. Michael Ziegler is the latter.

Zielger is the worst professor I've ever had in my life. You can barley hear what he says because he mutters half the time and his handwritten on the chalk boards isn't legible. He is a smart guy but can't get on students levels to actually explain the stuff and he doesn't care about the students at all. Little outside help and just a mean guy.

Lecture was very confusing and I usually did not learn anything from it. The only reason I went to class was to see what we were supposed to be learning. Then I looked up Khan Academy videos to learn it.

Worst class I've ever had. Quizzes and exams are extremely hard and you only go to do quizzes. Lectures aren't helpful at all and the book isn't enough to help you understand the material. RUN, DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS.

Probably the worst professor I've had at OSU. Terrible lecture notes and havent even attended lecture in weeks because it's just an all around waste of time. If you took physics in high school the class is extremely manageable but for a first time physics students this would be an incredibly difficult learning environment.

One of the most important things you need to have as a professor is social skills, which Im sorry, but he does not have. He is downright rude and unhelpful. He may have the experience and knowledge, but he cannot properly communicate that with his students.

It doesn't matter which professor you take, they will all be challenging if this is your first time ever studying physics. I thought he was a fine professor. I just think this class is extremely difficult.

If you find out you have this guy, transfer out of his class immediately. He gives hard quizzes and exams and is not good at teaching you the material. Also does not provide any sort of material to practice for the exams. I felt like I was set up for failure this semester. I will repeat myself, TRANSFER OUT OF HIS CLASS IF YOU GET HIM.

Worst professor out there. Does not explain stuff. Gives impossible exams with averages below 50%. Very rude. Does not know how to explain stuff. Lectures are useless because he talks to the chalkboard and writes illegibly.   He keeps talking about a curve and I hope it is a good one.
Avoid. Lecture was borderline useless. Passing usually relies on the heavy curve resulting from impossible exams. Textbook is the only way you will be able to do somewhat ok.

By far the worst teacher I've ever had. The only thing he does when lecturing is the easiest example problems from the book, yet his quizzes and exams are near impossible. He's dismissive when you approach him during office hours or after class; he truly makes you feel like an idiot. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
He is just plain horrible. AVOID his class at all costs!
Does not explain how to do the problems at all. Midterm was impossible. AVOID him at all costs!

I am an average student and had to drop the class.  Ziegler had POOR use of the chalk board.  lectured with his face about 5inches away from the board.  No eye contact w/ students. Constantly says "uh, huh"  If you already know the material then great.  Otherwise run b/c he is NOT a good lecturer.  I had Yang for 111 and loved him.

Said um, uh, ahh or some variation at least 90 times in one class period. Does sample problems from the book. His quizzes and tests are next to impossible, he thinks he is creative when he makes problems that no other class would give.  I wish I had the other Physics teacher.

Dr. Ziegler was excellent at putting me to sleep during lecture. He was extremely unorganized, and very hard to understand. His notes were messy, and hard to follow. He was more concerned with how the formulas were derived than what the actual formulas were. Try to get another prof, and if you get langmack as a TA, drop/ change sections immediately!
This is possibly the worst professor to ever teach ever!!! Never have I heard Um and uh used so many times during a class. MORON
I seriously hate this guy with a passion.  He is the WORST TA IN THE WORLD.  He doesn't help you at all.  He WROTE the lab manual and still took 40 minutes to explain Lab #1.  What a choch monger.

He was unhelpful with any questions, told us to figure it out for ourselves and that the concepts that he taught were simple and that we should know them.  I took this class as a refresher before starting engineering physics classes and only found it to be helpful because I was able to teach myself others in the class were not so lucky.  BAD TEACHE
Did not this guy at all. I learned more from the book than from him. Seemed to have no interest in teaching. Class easy though. GPA booster. Quiz/exams easy.

cares about his students, but has difficulty communicating material to the average person. Instead of writing him off as a bad professor, be patient, and ask him to explain it differently. DON'T let your question go! keep asking in different ways, he will find a way to answer it.  He is a nice guy with a sense of humor once you get to know him.
NOT a good TA. Does not want to help students, and hard to understand.
No Comments
very rude when approached for help.  quzzes were very riddle-like...designed to trick students!
I had him for recitation...he does mumble sometimes and doesn't like to talk about what is going to be on the quiz or anything else.
Seems unorganized and he mummbles alot.
Had him for 111.  Was a great teacher.  Quizzes were cake, exams were ok.  Stickler with the grading tho.
i had dr. ziegler for recitation and lecture.  in lecture he was pretty amusing. but he didn't really prepare us for exams. recitation was very fast (all homework problems).

He's one of my favorite professors of all time. He actually made physics fun and interesting. I had another professor for 1251, but I heard about Skinner and after I watched his video lectures, I actually started learning the content pretty well. He'a a beast at physics and explains things super well. He's also pretty funny in lecture.

He's by far the best the Ohio State Physics Department has. If you have him, go in person to his lectures, his demonstrations are actually interesting. If you don't have him, go to his lecture anyways it's the only way you'll survive.

I have another prof for 1251, but I watch Dr. Skinner's videos because he is just that amazing at teaching physics. He explains the material in a way that is easier to understand and is very passionate about his work. His lectures are funny too.
Probably the best professor I have ever had. Truly a fantastic professor!
Best physics professor I've ever had

Skinner made physics pop!  I liked how he recited all of his lectures in iambic pentameter.
He did demonstrations where he brought in a car he built out of smaller cars and made it do physics he also taught me in 5th grade and that's where it all began so you know.
Also, he never made me do a dance in front of the class like everybody else.
Great professor! His lectures make physics easy to understand. For my class he made every class available by zoom and zoom recordings. Definitely would recommend!

TAKE SKINNER!! Hands down the best lecturer I've had at OSU. He's genuinely passionate about teaching and it shows. Lecture notes are incredibly useful, he's organized, accessible outside class, and does a great job of explaining material without straying outside the scope of his class. His midterm averages are 10% higher than other 1251 profs!!
Best physics professor Ive ever had, you actually learn!

Dr Skinner is amazing, by far the best physics professor ive had. He really wants you to understand the material and explains it in a simple way that makes it relatively easy to understand. The TAs do a great job too. Lectures are engaging too. Wish he could teach all the physics classes I take.

worst professor i've ever had. he's not a chem professor, he's a physics professor. he doesn't explain anything, he's impossible to reach outside of class, he's impossible to understand during class, and you basically have to teach yourself the entire class on your own. if you see his name, drop immediately

Huge curve. My 83% earned an A-. My advice is to make sure you do really well on the homework (it's easy and you drop two). Cram before quizzes. Zhong will straight up tell you what questions are on the exams the week before. It wont be exactly the same but it's very similar to what he outlines. RECORD THE LECTURE when he does this. Helped me a ton

Dongping gets a bad rap but he tells you exactly what is going to be on the exam. If you look at sample problems from HW and quizzes related to what he shows I can guarantee those Qs will be on the exams. Take time to understand those Qs and you will do just fine in this class. Online HW is hard but similar problems w solutions can be found online.
Didn't do a great job of explaining things, typically didn't respond to emails. Physics department is slim pickings but Zhong would always crack jokes

out of every lecturer for physics1250, zhong is the best bc he will tell u verbatim what is on the midterms. he will go over a lot of examples that end up on the exams. the accent may be hard to understand at first but he can be funny at times. this class is NOT easy, requires a lot of hours, so many concepts we learn that never end up on exams

How in the world did this guy become a professor and why am I paying a s*** ton of money for him to read off his own slides during lectures. He barely used the board. I had to read every topic's Wikipedia page and watch Walter Lewin's lectures on YouTube to pass this class. Also, use Google instead of the textbook. Textbook is slow and cumbersome.
Hard to understand, does not care about student success (makes students feel stupid). Not good at answering questions, had to learn on own. Terrible feedback.

Wouldn't recommend chemistry courses at Ohio State. This professor specifically has a strong accent and is difficult to understand; I mean this in the most respectful way possible. He was so difficult to understand that I stopped attending lectures. Heavily focused on research which affected teaching. Will retake this course at Columbus State.

By far one of the worst professors I have ever had. He made things incredibly hard to understand. Exams were around 30 questions and you only had 70 minutes to complete, but that is the Chem department's fault. Also, he assigned recitation assignments on Saturday and due Sunday. All were about 40 questions on average. Do better.

I had the online version of this class. His accent is not too difficult to understand. However, understanding the material is a whole different thing. You would be better off skimming through the lecture slides and study either from the textbook or khanacadamy. He does hint us some questions that will be on the test, but it is hit or miss.

The midterms were not too bad, but the final did everyone dirty. He likes to spend time making sure you get the concepts and tells you exactly what he is going to test you on during the midterms. As long as you can understand what he says, you should be fine.

Zhong genuinely cares about all his students and his accent seriously is not hard to understand after you attend the first lecture. Always attend the class before the exam because he tells you what all of the questions will cover. The exams and quizzes are fairly easy, if you go to lecture and try the homework without Chegging every question.

Dr. Zhong is very nice he is always willing to help you, and he sets lots of office hours for one on one meetings before finals. Paying attention during review sessions is your key to success he literally tells you everything you need to know. I would recommend him to my friends. He is the best in the physics department! :)

Dr. Zhong was a great professor who you could tell really cared about his students and physics. His quizzes and tests were pretty difficult so you definitely had to put in the time to study for those. He was a little hard to understand at first but really not that bad, he's really funny in lectures!

His lectures weren't bad. His accent isn't hard to understand, and I like the amount of conceptual examples he gives. He usually hints pretty clearly as to what exactly will end up on the exams, which were always fair. Not bad. Not great.
He is very difficult to understand, and doesn't help you prepare for his exams. which are very long. The homework is so difficult that the tutors in the tutoring center can't figure it out.

Dr. Zhong overall is a good teacher and cares about helping his students. The main problem I had with him was that he had a very thick accent and it was difficult to understand him at times. Also because of this it was easy to let your mind wander in class. However when teaching, he explained things to the best of his ability and helped students

Dr. Zhong's teaching style was a little bit hard to get used to at first, but overall I thought he was a good professor. You have to remember that the class itself is very hard to begin with so you can't expect to cruise through without putting in the effort. His midterms and finals were fair and he was a very nice guy.
As far as physics professors can go, Dongping is fine. Quizzes aren't bad, exams fine. He likes the conceptual questions on the multiple choice.

Dr. Zhong was difficult to understand at the beginning, but overall I got used to his teaching style. Physics, in general, is hard, so don't expect flowers and butterflies. I put in at least 5 hours a week or at most 10 hours (esp for that stupid hw). His exams/quizzes mirrored his lecture notes. Go to office hours, he gives good advice. Good luck!
Very difficult to understand and very confusing.

I enjoyed Dr. Zhong's class. He was very hard to understand at first, but once you do you realize he's both funny and very clear as to what is on the exams. He is also very accessible outside of class and holds plenty of office hours, with extra ones closer to exams. Tests were also very fair, never any trick problems and mostly problems from class
Truly awful class. Disorganized lectures and hard to understand. Would never recommend.

If you speak Chinese then maybe you will be fine in this class, but unfortunately i do not. He was extremely boring and hard to understand and I found that going to the lectures was pointless because I would either fall asleep or write down the wrong information. His tests were also more difficult that some of the other profs. Avoid if possible.
Good luck, you're going to need it if you have him as your lecturer.

He is an awful professor; he cannot teach! Between his heavy accent and awful lectures, he is the worst professor I have ever had! I will admit that the class itself is difficult, but he did not help at all. I do not recommend!
Pretty good professor!!! You worthy him.

Dongping was a good professor.  It took a little to understand his accent and the way he says a few words in particular.  His quizzes were fair, usually were examples he went over in lecture.  Need to go to class so you can get the answers to the lecture slides and important examples.  The exams were fair but a little difficult.  The finals awful.

Dongping was a great professor. His tests and quizzes were very fair - not too difficult, but definitely also not easy. A lot of this material came directly from his lecture slides so definitely attend class regularly. Homework was awful and way harder than the tests.
I felt like I couldn't understand him because he was just too smart to teach. He didn't understand why people didn't understand. Ended up going to another lecturer. PS he reuses assessments.

First off you cannot understand him.  The way he lectures is terrible for taking notes.  I ended up going to another professor the entire year and it helped me tremendously.  He has easy tests though and will give away many of the questions on quizzes and midterms in review sessions and class.

Dongping is super funny and seems to care about his students. You will hear this time and time again--you get out what you put in. Do the homework, go to class, go to lab, go to office hours, and apply yourself and his classes aren't bad at all. They're no cakewalk, but definitely manageable.

In my opinion, Dr. Zhong is totally great! If possible I will take his class next semester. The quiz and exam are not so difficult if you listened to him carefully in every class and review lecture notes before test. He got a little accent but I think it's OK!

Totally cool guy, but very thick accent. The more you show up, the easier it gets though. Would highly recommend showing up to class. The class is kinda tough, but Dongping is always willing to help when asked.

He's a pretty funny guy if you really listen to him, but he's very hard to understand. I started to succeed in this class when I stopped going. Become best friends with your TA; they're their to help you.

Really, you can understand what Dr. Zhong is saying if you try and he's kinda funny. Still, he rambles on about things that aren't really important and drives focus away from the topic. Your grade is mostly determined by the TA anyway - if yours is bad, your grade will be too, because there will be concepts you don't get in class & need help with.

Very hard to understand what he is saying because he doesn't speak English very well.  However all of his test question come straight from the lecture slides so just study those examples.  He missed many lectures and had a sub fill in for him who was even worse than he was.

You have to figure out what he is saying before you could even begin to comprehend what he is trying to teach. Doesn't explain things well and acts like hard concepts just come naturally. Obviously cared more about his research than his students. Do not take unless you are prepared to teach yourself everything.

Okay this guy is NOT THAT BAD. His accent predisposes people to immediately dislike him, which is understandable to an extent. But he really does a great job giving thorough explanations of the concept questions he provides IN CLASS. That is the part that matters the most, and everybody who sucks at physics doesn't go to class and misses these.

Relatively helpful outside of class, I'm sure he's a generally nice guy. But cannot teach a lecture worth going to, at all. Apparently within 10 years of teaching, he still can't speak with full comprehensibility and his grammar is still shaky. Not to mention, he mostly just reads off his ppt slides with unhelpful explanations. The book's better.

He's actually a funny guy, some of his jokes made me laugh. But he is pretty hard to understand and he would explain easy problems in lecture, but test problems were much harder. I had to teach myself a lot of the material. But he is a sweet guy and wants to help.
Very hard to understand his lectures...............
He is extremely helpful and smart and knows how to teach.
hard to believe the good reviews

Class is a joke nothing taught in there actually helps you prepare for the quizzes. He does not tell you what's going to be on each quiz. Although I found some of the experiments entertaining. But still did not help me understand what he is trying to teach. Good guy; very intelligent, but just to hard to understand the concepts.
excellent and very helpful...
He is excellent!!!!

Very knowledgeable, but he is extremely hard to understand and he is not good at explaining things, but he does try. Also don't take his word for what will be on the exams, study everything because what he says won't be on there often is.
He's such a nice guy, but hard to understand!
A nice guy, has a good sense of humor and makes many concessions to help students out.  A note though- his English isn't so hot.
Excellent lectures!!! very smart...
He is sooo cool!
He is a good teacher and very smart.very helpful for students
The test is easy but it is trick.Professor is really helpful and has passion to teach. I like the class.
The lecture is very clear and powerpoint is useful though his English is not super good.
Confusing, you'll learn more from reading/rec.
very knowledgeable and helpful, serious about teaching
I can't understand anything and he gives me a headache
excellent teacher and well prepared class

Often hard to understand, but he's hilarious when you do understand him. I can't say I learned much from him, though. I learned mostly from practice problems and reading the lecture notes (which are all available online) and the book.
Hardly speaks english, you will spend more time trying to figure out what he said rather than understand the material.  Tests were easy though.
VERY FUNNY DUDE, make sure you go to the reviews because all the problems they give you are pretty much what is on the midterms.

Ok, he is a very caring individual who is always willing to help you after class, BUT, he does not know how to explain anything. Even if you still get help from him, you still won't understand what he's talking about because he just doesn't know how to explain the material. This makes his exams hard
Class is easy and he really tries to explain everything, even though his english isn't great. He is exteremly helpful though
good prof, really tries to help, and not confuse students.
he can't speak clear... maybe is because that he comes from china....however... he tried hard...and i think his midterms are all the problems that TAs told you, which is good...
very funny, and if you dont understand, go to his office hours, he is very helpful then.  very accomplished and smart teacher.  if you study, you will do well in this class.
Very unclear when speaking. Prepared with powerpoint note (available online) which makes going to lecture pointless because he uses them verbatum. Easy quizzes and midterms.
Unprepared, no planning, take many things for granted. Horrible language, need to try hard to understand what he wants to say. Exams though easy but not on time.

Dr. Nandyala was amazing. I had never taken physics before and was fully expecting to not do well in the class. However, he made everything very clear and was always willing to answer questions. He always went out of his way to offer extra office hours to those that needed it. The quizzes are mildly difficult, but the exams resembled them.

Thought the setup of the general physics course is not great, Nandyala is great with how accesible he is outside of class. At points during the final he would have office hours every day and after each lecture. He does not post his notes so much sure to attend lecture, and do not worry about the math at all.

This professor honestly cares! He will give you extra office hours if asked. If you are bad at math like I am-take advantage of office hours!!! you won't be disappointed! He genuinely cares that every student is succeeding! Tips-study from the book! this is where the exam comes from and subscribe to clutch prep! they have online videos and tutoring

Wow! This professor genuinely care for his students! He has given those who aren't able to study-extra office hours where he can individually teach students! literally just ask him for extra office hours! Exams come straight from the text book. He is an awesome lecturer as well and doesn't have a heavy accent at all. I will be taking him again!

Although it is possible that the physics department is caring for students, Dr. Nandyala was not the most responsive or helpful as a course manager. It takes several people to reach him and he hardly responds to emails. It seems a little disorganized and all over the place compared to other departments (ex. biology).
Dr Nandyala is definitely one of the professors for physics at OSU. He is super accessible with anything that you need and is genuinely one of the nicest people Ive ever met.

Dr. Nandyala is a great professor. If you show up to lecture and practice well before the tests you will have no problem getting an "A" in the class. Dr. Nandyala is also very helpful when approached with questions right after lecture. Also, many of the questions on the quizzes and tests are pulled directly from the textbook, which is always good.

Professor Nandyala cares a lot about student success. Physics is not an easy class for a lot of people, including myself, but he explains things very clearly, and I believe this class gives you a fair shot for success.

She is terrible at explaining anything in class. Her lecture notes was Wikipedia. Might have some useful lecture once every 2 or 3 weeks, but the rest of the days are miserable. She cannot understand most of the questions students asks, instead she just response with "read the problem". If you have a choice do not take her class, cause I didn't.

Took her for AST115. DO NOT TAKE HER. She teaches mostly off of wikipedia and creates her own lecture notes that are hard to follow. Homework is graded by the TA and there's a massive disconnect between the two. She doesn't care about students and only cares if you're in class paying attention. Often times goes on tangents about the big bang.
She used Wikcipida to teach in her lectures and didn't give us the correct information.
Extremely helpful teacher. She explains in a very easy way with lot of problems.
Very helpful in explaining the problems.. She is very helpful if student pays attention to the lecture, other wise gets mad if student asks for mark without doing the problem.

Recitation and Labs with Ruma were absolutely horrific.  She has trouble leading a class, often solves problems incorrectly, and has all too many problems with teaching.  Easily the worst teacher I've ever had.  I would have failed had I not known Physics from previous classes.

Easily the best physics professor I've had since I've been at OSU. Frankly, I've been very disappointed in the quality of instruction in the physics department. It feels like a lot of the instructors don't actually like teaching. Dr. Valdes-Aguilar is different. He genuinely cares about helping students learn, and he is extremely knowledgeable.

Very smart, very straightforward; you can't cheat him. Very accessible for help outside of class if you try even a little but for some reason most students do not seem to get this. He cares about his students and genuinely wants to them to learn and flourish. Great guy overall

An ok lecturer, but class policies are sometimes harder than the physics. If you format your work incorrectly, he will absolutely take every point off. Requires Carmen discussion participation like an online class. Daily quizzes due before class. All this leads to free points to pad your steadily declining grade for normal work. Stressful.

A on exams: memorize practice exam problems. A on mc quizzes: Use his example q's from lectures and the quick quizzes throughout the chapter. Course was well structured at the beginning, and shortly became confusing. Because the exams were identical to his practice ones, everyone did well and there was no curve.
Memorize every single detail in the practice exam and you are guaranteed to get an A :)

Dr. RVA is my favorite professor. Amazing PowerPoints used, well detailed & LOTS of effort into them. Make sure you read, or may become confused. His examples used in class are identical to the quizzes (GO TO CLASS)! The Midterms/Final has some REALLY hard questions, but similar to to the practice test. Make you work, but makes physics enjoyable!
The worst. He gives exams just like the practice exams so that he won't have to curve the class. He is a horrible teacher. The TAs aren't helpful either.
He gives boring lectures but quite easy exams. You will be easy to get scores above 90 in his exams.

His exams average is around 55 for 2 midterms and the final. Final was way to hard and couldn't be finished. He makes it to hard for the exams. It starts easy but once you get to rotation, it gets tough. Good Luck getting a good TA because they all can't teach..
Not very helpful in office hours, goes very quickly through lectures. My ta saved my ass in this class
Really boring professor. Frequently repeats himself. Goes over topics briefly then expects you know them. Problems done in class aren't representative of homework.

Awful professor. DO NOT EVEN TRY if you have not taken physics before. He lectures over different material than what he tests you on. The average midterm grades were below  63. Seriously, avoid at all costs.
Valdes-Aguilar skips important steps in class in problems and assumes we know how to do certain things. It makes it difficult to be interested in lectures.
Rolando is friendly, and pretty helpful in class. A lot of work is done from reading, and submitting questions to class.
Love Ralf, always helpful around the lab. Great lecture material, nicely designed course content.

Physics 6810 is set up so you can get a 10/12 on everything with a bit of effort, but getting 11+ is a bit harder. The class is very conceptual but laid out so you can get help and feedback fast. Dr. Bundschuh was extremely thorough in his lectures and explanations. Assignments were allowed to be re-graded. Not a bad class, just don't fall behind.
Easy class overall if you are willing to work on the problem sets (10+ hours a week).
Professor Bundschuh designs his class around the needs of his student. I am confident he could teach any subject and I would gladly take it.

Professor Bundschuh has a unique lecture style that, despite my initial doubts, turned out to be quite helpful. He doesn't actually teach the material; he asks that we read prior to class and then the lecture is purely centered on answering questions that the students submit the night before lecture. He is very helpful and quite a brilliant man.
Wonderful Professor. The class is difficult and you will have to work for a good grade, but you will definitely learn the material and understand everything!

This was a great class. Professor Bundschuh was extremely good at explaining all the material and was very helpful with the homework. There are weekly problem sets, which can get complicated at times. However, the tests are much easier than these and he is a very fair grader. I highly recommend this class if you enjoy physics.
One of my favorite teachers.  He was really helpful, and he actually liked teaching.  His accent was also very amusing during class.

Very good teacher. Always helpful during office hours. Quizes will make you think. Midterm makes sure you know your material. Reading is a must as he uses examples from the book as test material (similar at least). He's pretty funny too. Overall great professor!
No Comments
I agree with the earlier rater from 2011.  I too was in the 1987 PHY 531 class and went to FermiLab with Dr. Reay.  I am a mathematics professor myself now and he was certainly an inspiration to me.
Dr Reay was very inspiring and a wonderful teacher and a great person

Bill Reay is a great man.  You can tell he knows the material and loves teaching it to his students.  He even took a group of students up in his airplane, which was amazing!  He was willing to take time to help students, as well as share his outside interests with us.
Dr. Reay is the best. I had him back in the 1987 and he took a group of us to Fermi Lab.  It was a great experience. I am now a professor myself and Dr. Reay is one of the reasons I chose academia.

The best physics professor possible.  He keeps things entertaining and still manages to teach.  Instruction is clear and he does a better job at it than any other professor I have had. Try to get into his class.

He is a great professor and his lectures are always interesting. He interacts with the students a lot and gets to know everyone's name. Very approachable and always willing to help you after lecture.  He's pretty funny too.

Dr. Reay is the man! Students from other lectures would come to watch him perform. Lecture is very enjoyable and interactive - it's very easy to learn with him. During midterm week, there weren't even enough seats for everybody who came to see him. That probably says it all - Dr. Reay's a nice, light-hearted guy who really knows his stuff.
Funny guy. Going to class is fun. Doesn't always teach the best but is very entertaining.

The material is relatively easy, especially in the beginning since it all builds on itself.  Once you get into special relativity everything was random and nothing built on anything and made the class hard to keep up with.  If you have a good TA, use them.  Final and midterms were fair, do the hw to keep up.
Really funny and interesting guy, makes lecture almost fun. Cool dude and great instructor!
he is a great teacher and funny guy. I really like the lab he showed during the class. it was really enjoyable and make the material easier. you really can't miss a awesome teacher like him!!

Awesome. Very funny, goofy, and very interesting. He cares a lot about his students. Learns everyone's name which is a nice personal touch. He might seem crazy at first, but he's the best professor out there. Get him!
Good teacher! His lecture is interesting and inspring. Very helpful! This man is passionate about what he's doing. He always visit the recitation question and anwser questions.
great teacher, lectures were really interesting, and he explained things very well. GREAT physics teacher! one of best professors ive ever had
Very good.
Very fun prof. I knew people who were in different sections who would attend his lectures whenever they could fit them into their schedules.
He really cares about his students and he tries to make everyone feel comfortable in his class. He really tries to get to know his students and he explains everything very well
I absolutely loved Bill's class. He always explained things well and made class really interesting. He's a great guy and really cares about teaching/his students.
Bill is awesome!
Prof Reay was really helpful and his lecture was very intresting.  He was an awesome teacher, I felt lucky to be in his class.  He is more then willing to go the distance to help out his students.
Only reason I went to lecture was because he was a funny guy.  Too bad the coursework was miserable.
Dr. Reay is pretty hilarious and a nice guy, though sometimes his examples are hard to understand and you don't really know what he's asking
i love prof reay!!! hes so cute, his voice still cracks and hes like 60! he explains boring things in a really fun way and always stops to answer questions.

He seems like a nice man and genuinely cares about his students, but in my opinion he doesn't provide enough explaination of topics and seems to be catering to the students who have seen the material in high school and already know the material well.
knows his stuff, and really cares about teaching.  its impossible to make this stuff easy but he works at it.

Mrs. Carpenter made the class online up until Spring Break. It was very hard to learn as her lectures consisted of her deriving equations on a notes app and broadcasting them to the class. I cannot confidently say that I learned a lot from this class and I honestly think she diminished my appreciation for Physics.

Dr. Carpenter spends the majority of lecture deriving the necessary equations for class, but she does not spend a lot of time giving examples of how to use the equations. I found it necessary to do a lot of supplemental self-teaching to keep up with the material, and there is a lot of busy work in the class, so that was difficult to maintain.

Dr. Carpenter is by far the worst lecturer I have encountered at OSU. She hand writes all of her lectures in the note app as well as the equation sheet. The class was extremely disorganized and no one in the class has any idea what is going on. She spends the whole lecture just deriving equations instead of teaching her students how to use them.

Lectures are so disorganized and do not teach anything, they are just her spending 55 minutes deriving equations and then not actually applying them to any problems. Lab is a joke, nobody knows what is going on because she doesn't teach. Exams are SIGNIFICANTLY harder than anything we have seen and also very different than other professors.
Worst lectures and lecture notes I have ever seen

My biggest stress this year, everyone is currently relying on the curve to not fail. TA does not do anything, lectures are long and information is thrown at you. Expect you to learn way too fast. Unless you love physics or have a prior understanding this class will be a hugeee struggle. Physics department is horrible.

I signed up for this class to be in person. It was moved online at the beginning of the semester and we were told it was "temporary" this is the only class that this has happened with. Professor Carpenter is the last person who should be teaching online. Her child breaks like 3 plates every morning and screams every 12 seconds. Waste of my time.

Not the most interesting lecturer given that she spends a lot of time deriving the formulas that you need for the class. Her handwriting is a little difficult to read at times so keep listening to her lecture for context clues. Exam questions were very similar to the ones covered in lecture.

Carpenter now provides equation sheets for her quizzes. I took the class during Covid-19 pandemic and she was one of my more thoughtful professors. She takes a more logical rather than conceptual approach to physics which I understand isn't for everyone, but if that is your learning style, then I highly recommend her!

Was behind in lectures at some points during the semester. Weekly quizzes with no equation sheet, and little partial credit if any. Some quizzes had typos or were missing the correct answer in multiple choice and were still counted as wrong unless the right one was written. Quizzes seemed to veer towards more obscure things we'd learned.

Professor Carpenter tries to be helpful and is very good at explaining problems when you go to office hours. Still, her lectures are sometimes useless as she takes half the time deriving formulas. Her quizzes do not include an equation sheet and her tests are very difficult and focus on randomly specific topics.

Dr. Carpenter's lectures were very tedious, repetitive, and boring, and were not much more helpful than the book. Quizzes were annoying because about half were multiple choice and no equations are given. A lot of problems required deriving the equation to solve the problem. Exams and quizzes are completely different than other profs.

Really enjoyed her lectures. She teachers with a lot of energy and enthusiasm. It seems like she really enjoys teaching, so if you apply yourself it makes it easier to learn what she is presenting. She explains the concepts and calculus very thoroughly. Very helpful and will even be there to help when she isn't having office hours.
Had Prof Carp her first semester at OSU, ever intelligent and helpful. She was available any time office hours or not. Laid back but gets the job done.

In a perfect world, every prof would be like Dr. Beacom. He cared about us as human beings instead of just students, and put his all into our success in every meaning of the word. I can never speak highly enough of this man. Take his courses if you can, you will be better for it!

Professor Beacom was my favorite teacher at OSU so far. He is very accessible outside of class, and office hours really helped me get an A in the class. While Physics 1201 is a difficult class, he does a great job of providing resources to help his students as well as being a great professor to go to for advice. 10/10 would recommend.

Professor Beacom is the best professor I've had at OSU. He offers many office hours at varying times to accommodate everyone and although I am not a big fan of physics, he made it doable. His quizzes are a little hard, but as long as you go over them afterwards and understand them the tests will be familiar enough to do well.

Dr. Beacom is an amazing professor and he truly cares so much about his students' success in and outside of the classroom. Physics is a hard subject regardless of the professor, so I thought the class was very challenging, but the lectures were very well organized and he offered numerous office hours and provided many resources. I 100% recommend!!

Dr. Beacom is an amazing professor and he truly cares about all of his students' success in the class and outside of class. Physics is a difficult subject regardless of the professor so the class was definitely very challenging, but Dr. Beacom's lectures were organized well and he offered many office hours which were helpful.

Amazing professor! Highlights what you need to know, and he gives you challenging quizzes which really help you prepare for the exams. He cares very much about individual success. He offers so many ways to help his students, from discussions posts online to in-person office hours after every class. Hopefully he is your prof for 1201.

Professor Beacom was an amazing professor. I cannot recommend that you take his class enough. His quizzes are a bit tricky but definitely not too bad and he is always willing to answer questions and help students out. Such a kind, caring and intelligent guy.
Gives very good outlines on what to focus on each quiz and midterm. Explains things well in office hours.

Professor Beacom knows how to make lectures enjoyable. He would provide quiz hints for every weeks quiz that were tremendously helpful. He also cared about individuals not as students but just as human beings. He always wanted everyone to succeed in his class and in life.

Dr. Beacom truly cares about his students and does everything he can to help them! Physics 1201 is not an easy course by any means but if you go to all the lectures and especially his office hours, you can achieve the grade you want. Dr. Beacom is not only funny and interesting, but a great professor who is patient and respectful of his students.

Dr. Beacom is a 10/10 awesome professor and overall great guy. He genuinely cares and wants every student in his course to succeed and do well. He incorporates fun and interesting demos in his class which help lighten the mood at times. His quizzes and exams are pretty tough, and he makes you work for your grade. Take Dr. Beacom if possible. 10/10.
Overall this class was very interesting.

Dr Beacom is a blessing from GOD- anyone who said different is probably just not good at physics (which is fine). Tests are hard, with lower averages, but always curved to compensate. Honestly hes the nicest, sweetest, most dad-joke guy ever. Like if I could adopt him as my dad, I prob would. A true angel. Take his class

Funny but exams are a nightmare. He is also very critical on quiz grades. Be prepared for more multiple choice points that one thought imaginable. He had the lowest exam averages, seriously, avoid him but maybe go to his lectures for he cool demos.

Dr. Beacom is by far the best professor I have had at Ohio State. He is brilliantly intelligent, but never uses this to seem better than students. He explains concepts in a way that is understandable and is very approachable in office hours. Lectures are very engaging. He believed in me even when I did not believe in myself!
Great lectures! Great demonstrations in class! Hard exams!
Great professor
His lecture is fine, but he makes exams way too hard!!! A lot of things are not covered in the lecture. He always runs out of time in lecture so he told us to read the book by ourselves.

Pick Beacom if you want the easy tests, easy A, but also if you dont want to learn much. Professor Beacom is horrible with explaining hard concepts. He loves touching over new material quickly and going straight to his demos instead which, half the time it is him throwing up something and failing to catch it. Hes a chill guy but just cant teach

Dr. Beacom provides ample opportunity to absorb concepts of physics for a variety of different learning styles. I recommend attending all of the lectures, as he provides MANY real world examples and tricks to remember tough lectures. He's a very cool guy outside of class as well, def go to his review sessions. He doesn't want you to overthink.

Dr. Beacom was an awesome Physics teacher! He made an effort to try to get to know his students, held lots of office hours, and his lectures were helpful. Do the homework, study his quizzes and the recitation problems, and read the textbook. You'll do very well by doing those things.
Even though I was really nervous to take Physics 1201, Beacom made the class really enjoyable and not at all impossible like many people made it out to be!
Really funny, and makes the class very enjoyable. Does a lot of cool and visual experiments during lecture to make it really memorable to students. 10/10 would take his class again

Great Professor - Really helpful and provides "hints" or topics to study before each quiz and exam. He does demonstrations at least once a week in lecture, which are helpful and engaging. Exams are tough and averages are low but a curve is applied to each exam. Definitely recommend.

His lectures were entertaining and easy to stay focused during. The quizzes and exams are very concept heavy rather than math, which I found made it much more tolerable than 1200. The class started out confusing but got better as it went on.
Definitely one of my favorite professors I've had!

Dr. Beacom is an engaging lecturer and focuses on the main, important concepts. Quiz and exam questions are conceptual rather than plug and chug, so studying hw questions doesnt help much. Dr. Beacom walks through physics step by step and makes the subject less daunting than it sounds!
Horrible Instructor, he would word exam and quiz questions in a unclear manner that makes confuses you even more. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

Best general science prof I've ever had. He offers multiple weekly office hours that were super helpful and provides carmen quiz hints. Don't need to read the book, just take good notes in lecture (blackboard style). He makes abstract concepts easy to understand, and quizzes/exams are extremely fair. I actually enjoyed Physics 2 w/him as a prof!
Beacom is a real gem. Never had a prof that actually made me want to show up to an 8am. A is very manageable to get. A super cool guy

From someone who has never enjoyed physics and took this for GE credit, Beacom was sent from above. He made 8 AMs worth it. He only focuses on the fundamental stuff and thinks complicated math problems are unnecessary, and cares more that you understand the core concepts. Expectations are made very clear, and his quizzes are very reasonable.

Dr. Beacom's quizzes and exams are almost all conceptual questions so its important to go to lecture. He posts literal fricken GEM quiz hints online. He encourages people to ask questions online and come up with their own potential exam problems.

Beacom has been one of the best professors I have had at OSU. He is clear with what is tested, lectures are taught extremely well and are fun to attend. He goes out of his way to set up office hours to fit everyones schedule. He also posts hints and tips for all quizzes and exams which helps immensely. I would take Beacom for all physics classes

Every time I ask Dr Beacom a question he responds dismissively. There's a feeling that he is always annoyed or too short on time to respect your effort to learn during his office hours. He does seem especially unhelpful toward certain "types" of students. If something changes, I'll remove this post, but for now, I am fairly disappointed.

I didn't have physics in high school so taking both 1200 and 1201 at Ohio State was difficult. Professor Beacom made 1201 so much more interesting and feasible! It still took a good bit of work but he clearly states what he expects his students to know for each exam. He is the most reasonable teacher you could find in physics!

Beacom writes out his notes on the board, no power points for this guy. He's goofy and gives weird/funny examples in class to help you remember concepts. Quizzes and exams were heavy concept related but he gives you a good idea of what he expects you to know. Go to class, study, seek office hours when needed and you'll be golden.

Dr. Beacom is the best introductory science professor at OSU, not just physics. He is clear with lectures and expectations, interesting and fun to listen to, and 100% devoted to students. Dr. Beacom goes out of his way to be accessible and give all students the best understanding of physics. If you have to take this course, this is who to take.

Definitely take Beacom if you can. He is super clear about what he expects you to know and doesn't worry about the random details the book may include. He even gives hints about exactly what will be on quizzes and exams, so go to lecture and read the Carmen discussions. I really disliked physics and he made the class so much better! 100% recommend.

Class was awesome - I hated physics and he really made lectures fun and interesting.  Plus, he often has "passwords" for exams in lecture; it's definitely a class worth going to.  While you do need to study for exams, he gives a good overview over what's important and the quizzes are good ideas on the questions.  Overall a great prof!

Dr. Beacom was an amazing physics professor. Everyone said that physics 1201 sucks, but he made this class not sucky. You should definitely go to lecture, as he tells you exactly what he expects from you for exams/quizzes. He also actively posts on carmen discussion boards to help answer questions, clarify doubts, and post hints for test/quizzes.

One of the top professors at Ohio State for sure. Really cares about students and does everything he can to get you to do well. He is active in office hours, responds to email quickly, and even posts on carmen discussion boards in case you can't make class. He rewards students for coming to lecture with hints. Highly recommend.

Dr. Beacom is the man! His exams were all very fair, and he genuinely wants all of his students to do well. He strives for a 77% average on everything, and honestly comes pretty close (with the exception of the final which had a lower average, but was still fair). TAKE HIM if you can, you wont regret it. Best professor I've had in my 4 years at OSU

Become is truly one of the best professors I have ever encountered during my 4 years here. Outstanding lecturer, explains concepts and ideas very clearly, and wants students to succeed. Do not take with any other professor. I would take every class through him if possible.

Dr. Beacom was great! He really cared about his students doing well. If you take Physics 1201, take it with him. He is the man. If you go to lecture he tells you pretty clearly what will be on each quiz and midterm, and they are extremely fair. Plus he makes the class interesting. Take him!

He is a great professor.  He offers a ton of office hours, and is very approachable.  I frequently go in to get help on the homework, and he is great about giving detailed answers to make sure you get it.  He is also a super dynamic lecturer, so you won't be falling asleep in lecture and might actually even learn

He is a great physics professor.  The quizzes and exams can be tough, but if you go to lecture he will basically tell you what is on them.  I hate physics with a passion, and he made this class 100% tolerable.  If you have to take 1201 make sure it is with him

Professor Beacom is super helpful! I struggled in the beginning but after going to him for help my work really paid off. He's a great lecturer and is always willing to take questions. He uses relatable analogies and encourages participation. He really gives you a chance to do well if you want to.

It was clear to me that Professor Beacom wanted his students to do well in his class and offered as much help as possible! You had to work for an A but it wasnt an overwhelming class. I enjoyed his class very much.

Four quizzes, five homework assignments, and a final. He drops your lowest quiz and lowest homework. He's really interesting to listen to and makes good analogies. He's very interesting and willing to help. Go to his final review sessions! Would take another class from him again. He's an awesome guy too, but you have to work for an A.
Too much hand holding and too arrogant.

He is a really great professor and awesome for learning more about space while fulfilling a GE. He gave out 5 homeworks  and 4 quizzes and dropped your lowest grade. The final exam was cumulative but manageable. Lots of extra credit opportunities. Class is optional but helps. All the lecture notes are online. Definitely take him if you can!

He is an awesome professor! Amazingly clear and helpful. You don't need the book at all, so don't buy it. The notes are all online for you to review, but it's still good to go to lecture because he gives extra credit for that and participating online discussions. He also gives you outlines on what is going to be on the quizzes and final.
Beacom is a great teacher! Very good at explaining things. Don't buy the book. If you study it's not hard to get an A. He tells you what's going to be on tests and gives out extra credit.

Awesome professor. He is dedicated to making sure the students understand the concepts, and he is genuinely interested in the subject. He provides great analogies, and sparks an interest in astronomy in most people. I learned a lot, and loved the class. If you go to class, take notes and ask questions, you will get a lot out of the class.

This was my last science GEC, but if I could I would go back and take as many of his classes as I could. He was a very easy to relate to professor and always explained himself extremely clearly. I sincerely miss going to this class every day.

John is an excellent teacher, and the subject matter is totally fascinating. Our comprehension of the material was always his top priority, and he was very careful to explain these massive concepts in clear, relatable ways. The course really wasn't difficult, but I learned a massive amount of information and enjoyed the process.
Great professor! Extremely knowledgeable and makes difficult concepts easier to grasp. Makes space even more interesting; highly recommend him.

Awesome professor for Astron162. I hope, for future student's sake, he teaches it again. He is a master of analogies, and absolutely knows how to explain difficult concepts. Easy to listen to, and a funny guy.

He is a very good prof for this class.  Highly recommend him because not only does he makes the class interesting and easy to learn.  Give hints on quizzes + final.  Don't take anyone but him or you'll regret it.  Funny guy too!

Best science professor I have had! If you go to class and participate, which he forces many to do ;) and try on the homework, you will be able to do well in this class! He is an amazing professor and uses a ton of examples and experiments to help visualize the material

I think many of people have a problem with physics 112 after coming from physics 111. Trouble comes from the conceptual nature of the material in 112. The hw questions assigned in 112 pertained to quiz and exam questions but tended to be of a different form. Regardless of how difficult Beacom's quizes and exams were, it was clear he wanted to help.
prof beacom is a very reasonable guy and i recommend taking his class. where is that charming accent from? it's a mystery.

The concepts in this class are difficult to grasp if you don't study and put the effort into the class, but let's face it people you're in college now it's what you're supposed to do! Beacom is an amazing professor. You can tell he's passionate about physics, which makes learning from him enjoyable. He is also super helpful.

Physics 112 is definitely not an easy class, but Prof Beacom is one of the few professors that I've had that actually cares how his students do.  He tries very hard to make sure his students understand the material.  Quizzes/exams draw from concepts, which people struggled with, but if you skim the book, they're really not too bad.

Physics 112 is not an easy class due to the conceptual nature of the material.  The exams and quizzes are challenging and will require that you to study to do well. Prof. Beacom is one of those few instructors that devotes his time outside his normal hours as well as provides many resources to set you up for success. Highly recommend Prof Beacom.

Beacom is definitely one of the best professors at OSU, coming from a graduate who has had many. The concepts in the class weren't 1+1=2, but I wouldn't consider any of them hard. And if you understand the CONCEPTS, and visualize/draw what his questions ask, you'll get most of them right. The rest he'll likely curve and you'll pull off an A.

He was definitely interested in helping kids learn--he had review sessions, gave lots of hints in lecture. started a carmen discussion group, and answered emails quickly. I thought his test questions were often poorly worded and misleading, as well as far too difficult for our level of knowledge. But, overall, fun class, cool guy.

Very helpful professor, very interested in making sure everyone did the best they could do. Even started a carmen discussion forum to talk about the exam and what it would entail. Also was very quick to answer emails. As far as physics 112, its a very easy class, i didnt go to lecture and i usually skipped the second recitation and i still got an a

Dr. Beacom is one of the best teachers I have had at OSU. Make sure you attend lecture and recitation and take notes because that is what the exams cover, I never once opened the text. Make use of his office hours. The only problem was that exams tended to be long AND tricky, but that was compensated for by a curve. I would highly recommend him. :)

Physics 112 is hard, that's a given. Beacom teaches the material however with great clarity and simplicity so students can grasp key concepts and ideas for further use in life. The tests and quizes are challenging, however Beacom is aware and will curve them. Tests are supposed to be hard, they test your knowledge. Kickass teacher!

Prof Beacom is an extremely good professor. He pays attention to his students and teaches the subject as well as it can be taught. His exams are not hard, people just need to learn how to open a book. Highly recommended.

Physics 112 with Beacom is one journey of a class. I mean he's a good guy, he was willing to help and had office hours, but the material was just brutal difficult. I found most of it to be completely irrelevant to my major of computer science.

This course is very difficult mixed with a poor professor it is that much harder. He does not teach you how to apply the material for tests and his exams/quizzes are near impossible. if you have not had physics before invest in a tutor and get used to reading the book early. With generous curves you will get by, but don't expect to learn anything.

Beacom is extremely helpful and has office hours all the time! If you have any questions whatsoever he is very approachable! He is super attractive, mainly his personality but he is a cutie! He has a crazy beard! Love this guy!!

CHILE PEPPER! Beacom has the best personality ever! He is hilarious and extremely helpful! If you can take his class, definitely recommend it! Love him!! Hope he is teaching 112 in the Fall! He is brilliant! Labs are lame and really long and boring but you have to go. Lecture is optional but definitely go!!
Very good at explaining ideas clearly. He is also willing to help struggling students.
Very good lecturer who cares about his students. Able to teach in a sort of way that anyone in the lecture can understand regardless of their physics background.
Very outgoing and helpful! You'll actually learn something from his class!
amazing prof! highly recommend him to anyone. really puts in the effort to connect w/ his students. & has a great sense of humor, lightens things up!!
Prof Beacom is AMAZING! Very clear notes, very helpful, responds to e-mails quickly. Go to lecture. He makes it fun

Professor Beacom is phenomenal.  He genuinely cares about his students and will take the time to make them successful.  He is a great teacher.  If you have a chance to take anything with him...you should.  He is very knowledgable, approachable, and able to make complex ideas easily understandable.  He is one of the best teachers I have ever had!

Dr. Beacom is amazing, he made class fun to go to even though it was at 8:30 in the morning. Take him but be warned that the midterm and final are REALLY hard. Try hard on the quizzes and get all the points you can in lab and you'll do great. Beacom is SUPER helpful but sometimes his responses are vague(he tries to guide you.)

Prof. Beacom is great! Take his section, hands down. His notes are clear, he is super helpful, he curves the tests/quizzes. He responds to emails really quickly... wonderful teacher and funny too. A bit obsessed with Spongebob. :)

Professor Beacom is awesome! He is willing to help anybody that asks and is willing to do a little work..not to obsenely difficult and if he makes quizzes and stuff to hard he recognizes it and will filter the scores...he's amazing and funny! He makes it an enjoyable class to have in the morning.
He is real cool.
He is very heplful especially when he is your recitation TA
Professor Beacom was awesome...the demos he did helped me understand a lot of the concepts we talked about.
great professor, tests are kinda hard but study and it pays off

AMAZING PROFESSOR/PERSON. Dr. Beacom will everything he can to help students understand the material in physics 112.  He has a great, positive attitude which makes lectures more interesting and fun.  Regardless, the material is diffiult but I assure you that he is the professor to take.
Best Professor in the history of The Ohio State University.

Mr. Beacom really was the secret to my success in Physics 112. He was always willing to help me with homework or with whatever questions I had. He was a great lecturer who focused more on concepts then numerical problems. His tests and quizzes were challenging but not impossible.

Professor Beacom is a great professor. He teaches every aspect of the class clearly and if someone doesn't understand it, he continues until everyone does. He's hilarious and very down to earth. His quizzes are difficult at times, and so are the midterms, but if you study for this class it isn't that difficult. Big curve. Take him and study easy A.
reealllly nice guy. GREAT PHYSICS PROFESSOR! if you get the chance to take beacom do it.  he's hilarious, clumsy, blows stuff up, and rides around on his skate board. easy A

Dr. Beacom is a great prof. He makes physics fun and easier to learn.  He has a GREAT sense of humor.  He knows how to make students laugh and keep their attention in class.  He really cares about helping us do well.  The midterm was rough and the quizzes were sometimes tricky, but study hard and you will do well.

He is an amazing professor. Physics is not my idea of an interesting class, however he made lecture informative and fun at the same time. He TEACHES the material very well. His quizzes are little rough at times, but if u study them in the end along with his lecture notes you will do well. He cares that you get a good grade if you are working hard.
Prof Beacom was excellent! He was very helpful and made class fun.

Dr. Beacom is a wonderful lecturer. He's very responsive to student concerns and questions. He also does terrific demos (freely admits to liking to blow things up). He's very tough, but if you have a chance, take his class.

Professor Beacom has a great sense of teaching and humor, and therefore, lectures are educational and fun.  The material is challenging, but manageable if you put time and effort into the class.  The final was much easier than I anticipated.  His quiz and exam questions are reasonable.  I would highly recommend him.
Very interesting and makes physics more tolerable

Prof. Beacom was an excellent teacher. Attendence wasn't mandatory for lecture but I would highly recommend going. He would give you "hints" for the quizzes and midterms, and those questions were always featured on the test. He also does awesome demo's in class and is a funny, entertaining, helpful guy.
Great Teacher! If you have to take Physics 111, try to take it with Beacom. Class is challenging but is also curved.
Really chill professor, very helpful, very nice guy.  definitely recommend to all people who have to take physics 111.

Beacom is NOT a boring, old dinosaur. Hes fun and energetic, and he always drops SOMETHING every lecture (hes so clumsy). Quizzes and final are tough, homeworks were somewhat challenging. However theres a curve in the class. He keeps you interested with demos and he doesnt confuse you like the other professors. Take BEACOM for physics 111!
Hands down, a great teacher who turns an otherwise boring subject, into a great time.

i never took physics before and i was really nervous for the class but he is a great prof. - funny, helpful, understandable, and he gets his lectures done quick. exams aren't bad at all just study his notes and old quizzes

This guy is hilarious and he's a good prof too! you can still get an A without going to lecture--but he is pretty entertaining and does cool demos. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS-- you'll walk away understanding everything.
Beacom is da bomb.
good guy

Probably the best teacher I've ever had in a physical science.  He is a very good teacher & gets the job done in 48 minutes.  He also jokes around a lot so class isn't boring.  Gives great examples and demos.
No Comments

A very nice person but not ideal for common exams. Test averages consistently lower than Beacoms and the curve was ruined. Can tell he has a love for teaching but not ideal for the student. Rarely does practice problems and all of the homeworks are hard without the basics. Equation sheet also bad and missing things.

Dr. Soory's classes are not long enough for the material you have to learn- meaning you have to be able to supplement by yourself through the book. If you can do that, he's a good prof as he will cover the most general stuff you need to know. There is a lot of homework but the labs are easy enough. The exam and quizzes are tough so study hard.

He was good. Make sure you read the textbook though because not everything is explained perfectly in the lectures. He clearly cared about teaching the class but a few things could be difficult to understand and were better learned through the textbook or the assignments. It takes a lot of work but you can get an A.

I like Soory, I think a lot of the difficulty in this class comes from the amount of assignments. Soory's lectures are decent, you will have to read the book to supplement since there's too much to cover though. 9th Ed. of the textbook is really good, don't sleep on it. Soory did his best given La Corona so I have no problem recommending him.

This class is the reason I'm changing my major! I simply could not do well in it despite my best efforts. The quizzes and homeworks were all completed well, but the exams were just so difficult. For the final, I studied all of the previous homework, quizzes, and exams and I still did terrible on it because I feel Dr. Soory did not teach me anything

His lectures aren't too bad; they're actually fairly instructive. He is however really slow, and sometimes skips over some material in between that seems essential to understanding. Although the exam covers more of the homework than the lecture material, some of the questions make you apply both your practice and theoretical knowledge.
He is obviously extremely intelligent but the tests and quizzes were kind of out of left field. My class averaged a 58 on both midterms and a 60 on the final, thank the physics gods for the curve.

Nice guy and easy to understand, but lectures are mostly pointless. He derives equations you don't need to derive or re-explains things that are already understood. Quizzes and exams are similar to homework, but often a lot more difficult. 1251 needs a department-wide improvement, but Soory needs to focus on explaining what is necessary.

Dr. Sooryakumar was teaching 1251 E&M and he wasn't the greatest lecturer. Often times his lectures seemed tangent to what he expected us to do on tests and spent time on meaningless derivations rather than on teaching problems. He does care if you can see him but make sure you review your homework because midterms are very similar.

Professor Soory was super helpful and always accessible in office hours. I highly recommend going to those as he often gives great insight into upcoming tests and quizzes. His tests are difficult, but if you read the book prior to lecture and attend lecture, you'll be fine. The curve doesn't hurt either, but my 1201 class didn't have much of one.

Dr. Soory was very friendly and very passionate about physics. He is a great public speaker; his accent was not an issue. His lectures were a supplement to the textbook readings. The exams were based off recitation material, but the recitations were hands off and not very useful. Exams were difficult but graded fairly. Be prepared to study often.

One of the worst professors I've had. Soory is awful at explaining, which makes lecture seem like a joke to attend, but he bases his quiz questions off lecture and homework. His exams are similar to the quizzes and homework, but be prepared to see random hard questions. READ the textbook if you want to learn. Don't rely on the small curve.

Didn't even bother going back to lecture after the first 2 weeks of class because he is not helpful at all. Lectures involved all concepts and he never really teaches you how to do the math. His quizzes were harder than other lectures (averages between 40-60). Studied a lot for this class and will barely pass. Avoid this lecturer at cost
Lectures tended to drag on, and his accent can be confusing at times. Clearly intelligent and loves physics, just not the best at keeping students engaged.

Pros: He is easy to understand even though he has an accent. He understand that this is the first real physics class his students take.  Tests are fair ( 70%-80% average). He goes through many conceptual problems and practice problems.   Cons: His lectures focus on the math behind the physics concepts; need to read textbook before class

The best physics teacher anyone could ask for. I HATE physics and yet I like going to his class. I had the worst physics teacher in high school and basically came into his class not knowing any physics and now understand. He is very helpful and kind.
Really good, explains things really well, goes into great detail when explaining things and generally makes Physics interesting.

Its a hard class in the first place and he didn't really help. I couldn't stay awake in class. The quizzes were especially hard. In his defense he was a fair teacher but he didn't go real easy when grading.

He is the best Physics teacher I ever have I usually hate physics but he makes it really easy, his classes got a little bit boring because he is redoing the problems more than once to make sure all do understand them. Absolutely recommend him.

Good teacher, moves slow to make sure everyone understands it, almost moves too slow, gets boring during lectures, but obviously is very helpful if something is unclear.  Good prof, him and Reay (I think that's how u spell is name) are both very good, makes 132 as bearable as it can be

Class was very easy, I barely paid attention in class and got an A. He can be very hard to understand at times, but for the most part he is good. His reviews are direct examples of the tests which are very easy. Quizzes harder than midterms.
Great lecturer! Explains things well and can speak english pretty good too!

So many people here rated him highly, I didn't find him to be the awesome prof everyone made him out to be. He also personally mordified a friend of mine when she attempted to get an exam regraded. Take w/e prof there is for this course- he won't help you anymore than anyone else. Lectures are ok.
good guy

probably the best teacher i've had at ohio state.  he has exceptional teaching abilities... he is very clear in explaning princles and his examples are relevent and helpful to develop true understanding amoung his students.  he has no unrealistic expectations and he keeps class simple & entertaining
good tests
best physics teacher i ever had. clear and concise.
made hard topics easy to understand, willing to help
No Comments
Awesome teacher.  Clear voice fair tests.  Can't go wrong with Soory.
Has a thick accent thats kind of hard to understand in lecture.  he's always willing to help a student though.

Best physics prof I've had.  Lectures are extremely clear and helpful, emphasizes important topics in lecture that are usually on tests/quizzes.  Tests are fair.  Very willing to spend time to help during office hours....highly recommended!
A really good professor. He explains everything very clearly, does wonderful examples.  Tests are very fair and there is even a nice fat curve.  You cannot go wrong with this guy for physics.

Getting a good grade in this class took every bit of my time and energy this semester. However, I would credit Dr. Heinz for being receptive to feedback and very open to making changes in the format of the class. He understands the difficulty students face in gaining a good conceptual understanding of quantum mechanics and provides good advice.

Had Heinz for Quantum I. Great lecturer, he knows exactly what he is talking about. We had 3hr exams on Friday evenings (6-9pm). Weekly homework rarely took less than 8 hours to complete.
