He did offer extra credit on exams. Told us to read the book 3x through, so has high expectations of students. An A is possible, but takes a LOT of dedication.

Zach was my TA for this class. He was honestly so much more helpful than my professor (Barrett) and his office hours were so useful. This is such a hard class, and I still didn't do amazing, but Zach's guidance was so helpful. Strongly recommend him.

Ryan is a great TA. Super smart guy that went above and beyond to help his students. I know I would not have done as well on my exams if I had not gone to his office hours. He was the only reason I could understand 1251 content since Dr. Barrett's notes are barely legible. He sincerely wants his students to succeed.
Learned a lot from this class. Affirmed my decision to major in physics.

This is not an easy professor. He's absolutely hilarious and I think it's sad that people make fun of him. He's a very kind man but don't expect to kick your feet back and not keep up with the material on your own. Go to his lectures and write down everything he does on the board!

Considering that the physics 111-113 series dumbs topics down, this should not be a hard class. However, given an incomprehensible and utterly poor instructor like Lafyatis, the class becomes difficult and frustrating. It was so hard following his train of thought in class one day, that  I recorded the number of ums/uhs he said in one lecutre...515

Somewhat hard to understand what he will test you over, but overall if you understand the textbook sections he covers in class you will do fine, I found him to be much easier than my 111 or 112 professors even though his lectures don't prepare you very well for his quizzes or exams in my opinion
He is nice.

I liked him. He does repeat himself a bit but I think its more of him trying to convey importance to us. Lectures are a bit boring but its physics, so if course they're boring. He makes them slightly more interesting.

He's a really nice guy and he's very passionate about physics.  He's all over the place in his lectures and he repeats himself alot.  But he really tries to make sure you understand the material.  His quizzes are easy and the tests are okay.  He's really nice but he isn't the best teacher I've had.

Dr. Lafyatis is a nice man, but not the best teacher. He can be unclear and repeats himself a lot. His tests and quizzes are very fair. He tries hard to let you know what's important. I can't figure out how to change the numerical ratings, but he deserves a :)

Professor Lafyatis is a competent lecturer and a cool guy.  Physics is not a thrilling subject to me, but Professor Lafyatis kept my attention with his clear speaking style and unintentional humor (half the time something went wrong with the demos).

he isn't as bad as everyone says...he IS a bit nervous but does a fine job. class itself is really easy so dont worry too much. he is actually really cool and easygoing one on one. seems like a really nice guy and he really does try very hard. get one on one help from him and you should be good.

Very professional as a lecturer, although he does tend to trail off at times. Makes a great deal of effort to explain the material thoroughly, and is genuinely interested in helping students. A very modest and knowledgeable person overall.

He is a jittery man, but tries really hard to make things as clear as possible and is VERY willing to help students. He even let the class collectivlety take a quiz over since we had done so poorly on it. Pretty good guy, ok teacher
He repeats himself a lot, and going to lecture really doesn't help you learn anything.  His examples are usually very unclear and unhelpful.
He is realyl funy.  He stutters a lot and can be hard to understand but he is a funny guy and is very entertaining.  His notes are a bit disorganized, he seems very helpful though.
Not bad professor. Skip his lectures because they do not teach you anything. Attend recitation and read the text book.
Could not go to any of his lectures b/c he was SO ANNOYING to listen to!  He def. needs to take speech classes-He repeats everything he says, over & over & over. AGH!  VERY boring lecture

He means well, but often ends up rambling and repeating himself.  Very approachable and wants his students to do well.  He was my rec instructor as well--I think he did a little better in rec than in lecture.
Lectures are interesting, not enough examples in class.  Recitation and lecture seem like two completely different classes and not particularly connected.

he repeats himself ALL the time.  it's annoying.  he has very expressive facial expressions which are hilarous.  his lectures are boring because he kinda rambles and grumbles to himself.  he genuinely cares that we understand the material.
Found myself getting more one-on-one help from the TA than him.  DId a decent job explaining the material.  Makes lectures somewhat interesting.  Can get annoyed while listening to him.

Such a frustrating class - this one is meant as a GE, not a major course. But like others have said, it is graded like a major course. Test heavy. Professor is hard to understand. Average scores on exams were 40s to 50s.

I took online physics 1200 during the summer of the pandemic. i was scared to take a class this hard online, but Sharvil's class was very well structured, organized, and stuck to a schedule that was easy to follow along. His lectures were a bit dry and moved fast, but he did go through lots of problems and asked questions about what we understood.

his lectures were confusing, he went on tangents, & it's hard to pay attention. I went to his lectures initially but then stopped because I didn't find them beneficial at all. The final had questions that he and the textbook didn't even cover. Overall, I was just not a fan. He's smart, just not a good professor.
Great guy; best TA I've had and office hours were very useful

Begs people to ask questions but when you dont understand something he just sneers at you and tries to get other people to laugh at you. Writes unreasonably hard exams and then yells at the class for not doing better. Rude and a bad teacher

Super scattered and wont post his PowerPoints, leaving you no way to make up any lecture notes or review. The practice problems he does in class make no sense and often students have to point that hes made an error, at which point he doesnt even check his work, he just writes two answers on the board

He's a good guy. He's not a jerk. He was never a jerk to me or anyone in my class. Really intelligent  people can say insulting things to others and not realize it. Just take it on the chin and forget about it. Also, I advise reading the text for every class you take at OSU. Professors can't teach us everything

His lectures are kind of boring, but always asks for feedback to see if students are following along. He is very accessible in office hours and was very helpful everytime I went to see him. I enjoyed having him as a professor and would recommend taking his class.

Lectures weren't much help as he went over the same problem multiple times without explaining it in different ways. Most of my learning was on my own with the book and practice problems. Knows this is a GE class but grades us like we're in the major

Smart guy, awful professor. Doesn't relay concepts well. If you stay on top if it, however, you should do fine. Taking the time to actually do the homework, instead of looking the answers up online, helps tremendously.

Sharvil is not a good teacher. I have no doubt that he is very intelligent, but he's kind of a jerk and doesn't seem to realize students don't intrinsically have the same level of comprehension that he does. I loved physics in high school, but I got wrecked in this class.

His class can be kind of boring but take advantage of his office hours.  He can be extremely helpful.  Make sure you understand the homework and you'll do well on the exams.  Without studying much else besides the homework I got an A on every exam.

Dr. Desai is definitely extremely intelligent, but is unable to use that knowledge to help teach his students. I never missed a lecture, which if you did you would be completely lost, but still learned more from the book than him. He is extremely arrogant about his knowledge and is very cross when students ask a simple question.

Although he knows what he is talking about, he is very bad at presenting the material to students. Relies on PowerPoints for class notes & rarely uses demonstrations. He speaks mono-toned with an accent (accent is not hard to understand). He encourages questions but has come across as harsh to the student when answering the question a time or two.
I wasn't doing well in this class and had to drop, but he was solid helpful in trying his best to get me through this class. Very nice, even when I looked dumb. He's also better than the lecturer.
Very patient even when I would ask dumb questions, always seemed interesting in what someone had to say, also seemed very knowledgeable

Dan was caring, interested in the success of each student, and easily accessible outside of class. I had him for physics 1250 too, in person, and he was still just as attentive and accessible to each student, and he was easy to talk to.

Dan is a great teacher. Hes very approachable if you dont understand and will check to make sure everyone is on the same page before moving on. Hes passionate about physics and uses hands on experiences to teach.

She is a super nice person... but I kind of struggled in this class. I spent a lot of time on the lectures and homework because it would get confusing sometimes. it took her MONTHS to grade everything. the exams were a lot harder than the material covered in class, and you couldn't go back to answer past questions which sucked. don't recommend.

Mary is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. She also has a true love for physics and she gets excited when teaching her students. She really enjoys helping you learn and makes sure you understand whats going on. Shes one of those professors who actually likes the teaching aspect and not just the research. I highly recommend her classes.

Mary is a sweet woman with love of physics. I like her class and enjoy her lectures. Activities during lecture are funny as well. Just go to lectures, do homework and review the material before exams, you can get an A!!!

Mary is a wonderful lady and has a love for Physics. She explains well especially one on one and the class is set up in a way that isn't boring. Tests are very tough though, i was in a shock after the first one but studying can fix that.

Mary is wonderful, so sweet & really cares about her students. She is so helpful & held review & open hours leading up to each test. I recommend taking advantage of these. At times it was difficult to solidify the concepts & the tests were incredibly difficult. Not like any questions we practiced before. I don't recommend the class, but I do Mary.

Mary is such a sweet lady. She truly made physics fun. The miderms are kind of difficult. The classwork is not too bad, you can work on it in groups. I love Mary, she will help you if you don't understand something.

Class is mandatory, but she makes it interesting and fun. Homework and in class activity sheets are graded for completion. You definitely have to study for exams, but they're not impossible. Great teacher, would highly recommend her for any GE science course!
Mary is a wonderful instructor!! Her class is interesting and she is always willing to help!! The is a very easy class. Very easy to get an A if you have had physics in high school.
I wish she could teach every class for me! She is more than willing to help in and outside of class. She makes the class fun and has an infectious positive, enthusiastic attitude.

Mary is an AMAZING prof. One of the best that I have had while at OSU. I really hate science, but i love this class. Every lab is group work and she is very easy to understand and all you have to do is ask if you don't know the answer. There are few points in this class so make sure you do the work. I did the rev. midterms got a 100 on my midterm.
Mary is great. She is so nice and so willing to help anyone. The material is easy and she is a good teacher. TAKE THIS CLASS!!
Really easy class. Go to class and you will most likely get an A. Books are only about $40 total or so. The class is pretty fun and Mary is awesome.
Very nice teacher and cares about the students.  Take this class if you hate science.
She tries for everyone to understand and will help you if you ask or if she thinks you need it without any reservation.
This was a great class! She does an awesome job of helping the students learn and becoming interesting in physics! She really doesn't want you to fail!
Very nice lady. Wants her students to enjoy her class. Pretty easy class.
She's a really nice person, extremely helpful and patient. Her class is REALLY easy. Best TA ever!!
great teacher

Dr. Gupta gets a bad rap but he wasn't that bad. I have not heard anyone say their OSU physics prof was amazing (my 1200 prof wasn't any better than Gupta). The class is hard and Dr. Gupta struggles a bit with lecture explanations, but he is very helpful during office hours. Utilize those and read the book and you will be alright.

This class was definitely difficult. If you read the book and take good lecture notes then the quizzes become a lot easier. I had to watch the lectures twice in order to fully understand the material so be prepared to spend a lot of time on it.

Lectures are extremely confusing, he is more math focused and doesnt explain concepts very well or at all, never gives definitions/context for things, often runs out of time. Lots of top hat questions that dont help. Not helpful during recitation either, he confused us more often than helped us.

Due to the pandemic, everything is online. This is Spring 2021. Here are the cons I see after the first week of class: -They expect you to teach yourself from the textbook -no pre-lecture notes -no zoom recordings, just audio recordings  can't follow writing - no overall equation sheet yet, just have to make your own. not enuf characters for more

Dr. Gupta was, overall, a good professor. He seemed knowledgeable, but sometimes didnt connect topics well enough. His quizzes and exams were fair, but definitely challenging. I really appreciated his course OneNote, where he posted notes as well as recordings for each lecture.

Jay is really nice and cool and lectures are very interesting but theoretical and doesn't do many actually applicable problems in class. It's very hard to track down exactly what you need to know for tests and quizzes the material is all over the place. The only reason I'm doing okay is because my recitation Prof holds great review sessions
He actually is the absolute worst professor I have ever had at OSU. His lectures are pointless and he makes his tests ridiculously hard for a physics 1200 class. DO NOT choose him as your prof!!!!

Prof Gupta is a nice guy but not a very good teacher. I did well in the first half of the semester because it was all material I learned in high school. I stopped going to some of his lectures because he often times confuses himself with the material he is trying to teach us. If you've never taken physics, don't take this class with him.

Prof. Gupta truly wants his students to do well in his class and tries his best to make lectures as interactive, relatable, and fun as possible. I would definitely recommend him if you're looking to take an entry level physics class.
helpful
